title: and I love it. Since I've had it
author: M. Wolfe
comments: I've had this tub for almost three years, and I love it. Since I've had it, I buy it as a baby shower gift because it's such a versatile product. I have two children with whom I used this product from infancy to around 7-8 months, or whenever baby started crawling for efficiently.When in use, it's easy to set up, fits into all sinks I've tried (two different kitchen sinks and three different bathroom sinks), and contours well with baby's body. It is made in such a way that if you keep the water running over it, the water drains through the bottom flaps, so you don't have to worry about it overflowing and possibly putting baby in danger. It's soft for baby's comfort but still has grip so baby isn't sliding everywhere. Both of my children that used this never showed any sign of discomfort and actually seemed to enjoy bath time. Because it has no base, you can adjust it at different angles in the sink to elevate the head at your discretion, or lessen the elevation for babies that are not able to sit up on their own yet.My second favorite part about this tub is how easy it is to maintain and store. It unfolds flat for easy washing. Many tubs have little nooks and crannies that require more effort to clean, but the Puj tub is flat so I just wash it down with a handheld shower then hang it on the wall above the tub to dry. When we travel, it folds easily into our large luggage.I have two kids 14 months apart, so I used this tub A LOT until my youngest was old enough to sit up and control his balance in the normal tub. I used this product almost every day for nearly two years and never had a problem with it. I highly recommend it, and will buy it for you if I'm invited to your baby shower.

title: Measure sink before buying (or try the hack we used)
author: JK
comments: We have purchased or received no fewer than FIVE baby bathtubs and this one was our favorite. The major downside is its size - our baby grew out of it at 8 weeks when she was around 12lbs and 23" long. Also, you must have a very specific sink size in order for this tub to fit perfectly (6.5-9" depth x 12-15" length and height; see photo of packaging). I really feel this info should be more prominently placed!We had a slightly wider than ideal pedestal sink, so used a shoebox sized plastic tub on the right hand side of the sink counter, which we filled with warm water that we used during the bath, to serve as a "backstop" for the right side of the tub, making it stay together easier. Our sink had a ledge on the sides, which anchored the box in place, and thus kept the puj from sliding.You may need to play around with a similar set up,  based on your sink/counter configuration. If you can come up with a good hack (or have the ideal sized sink), this is a really wonderful tub for your newborn!

While initially it would seem that the tub would sit in place in the sink and that I could wedge it in the sink, once I placed my baby in the tub, it would move pretty quickly and be unhedged. Imagine sitting in an unsteady piece of styrofoam, floating in water. Yeah, doesn't sound good at all. Also, with the slipperiness and trying to wash the baby, it's easy for the baby to hit his head on the counter or sink. I kept trying to make it work, and, when my husband said that the baby almost hit his head when he used it, that was the last straw. While other bath tubs do take up more space, at least they are safe, easy to use, and, honestly, this tub is so weirdly shaped that it's not easy to store either! You either hang it up flat, and it has a weirdo footprint then, hogging up your wall space and looking weird, or you fold it into the tub shape, and there is no good way to store it. I actually kept it inside my actual adult bath tub just sitting there in the middle of the tub. So, at that point, might as well just get a plastic tub. I think my baby would have been more comfortable bathing in a water cooler. I did love the color though and that it didn't need to be wiped down/just dried fast on its own. I think it's a great idea, and I like supporting women-invented businesses like this one is, but I can't recommend it. I should have bought a little plastic tub (which you can get for even lesser than this -- I mistakenly thought I was saving money). I finally ran out and got the 4moms tub at Target, which is great and fits perfectly in double sinks. The baby really enjoys his baths now, or at least isn't cowering scared. It's possible I wasn't using this tub right, but I am a harried new mom. I don't have time to troubleshoot something that I could find an easy replacement for. comments: Great product! I got it on sale and am definitely getting my use out of it. I had a csection and cannot comfortably bend into a bathtub to bathe my baby. However, this fits perfectly in our sink and doesnt put a strain on my back or my incision. I can easily bathe the baby by myself using the Puj Tub. title: Great idea, doesn't look comfy.
author: michelle monroe
comments: I love the concept behind this product, but I find the foam to be a bit thin. It's a great idea and fits in all of my sinks, but if the foam were thicker I think it would hold it's shape better. My daughter never crus when in it, but it just looks like it would be uncomfortable.

title: Great product. Simple. Easy.
author: Luis Lalieu
comments: Excellent product. Same item used for my two babies 1 1/2 years apart. Very easy to use, simple, non expensive, and your baby will enjoy it.

title: THE BEST
author: Bethany O.
comments: Given to me by a friend at a baby shower, who said as soon as she used one, it became her "go-to" shower gift because it was so perfect.  now, along with the baby 411 book, it is my "go-to" baby shower gift. This tub is really truly PERFECT for newborn through 6 months baby.  I used this tub from newborn through about age 6 or 7 months, when baby had the muscle control to really sit up in the sink on his own.  I also own an baby/ toddler plastic tub which I switched to shortly after this one.  Although the plastic tub had a newborn "sling" it really did not compare in terms of ease of use for several reasons.First, the puj sits at a good angle in your sink allowing baby to recline.  You wash baby as baby is reclining, without having to manipulate baby's position while wet.  So much safer.  With the other tub, I felt that I always had to keep one hand on babys back at all times, whereas with this tub, the baby is safely cradled so that you have both hands to use to wash.  Water pools slightly at the bottom of the puj so baby stays warm, however. drains fairly quickly.  I usually kept the water running through the bath and let the water run on the side of the puj, which kept baby warm and the tub slightly filled with water.  Also, it is SO much easier to give baby (0-6 month) a bath at sink level rather than bending over to use the tub or infant tub on the shower floor.  Especially if you have a c section (I did) and bending over those first few weeks was painful.The foam backing is soft and very flexible, and I took this with me on trips and seemed to fit different sinks with ease.  Also, just fyi, it comes in one large piece that you fold together along lines to create the reclined position.  Very, very easy to clean up:  just flatten, run water over, done.  Also stores easily:  I put mine in the shelf with the cookie sheets in the kitchen.This was one of those miracle items that made the very scary idea of bathing a newborn and small baby very safe and easy.  it also  just gave me a lot of peace of mind about baths.  H-I-G-H-L-Y recommend to new parents.

title: The size/fit is deceiving...otherwise great!
author: Rebecca
comments: I love this tub but it seems to be meant more for smaller sinks. I tried it in our kitchen sink which is rather large and it sunk right down. If I set it inside a pot though it's a perfect fit and angle. It's too big for our teensy bathroom sinks. So just be aware if you're planning to use it in a kitchen! I'm still glad I bought it for space saving and ease of cleaning!

title: Bathe Anywhere
author: W&E*HIX
comments: Our second purchase for this item.  Babies for on-the-go mom's always have a safe bath whether at home or when traveling. Also, quite a space saver

I tried it anyway and noticed th following:Cons:-with the way the puj tub was positioned in the sink, the faucet was too close to the baby which worried me-the baby can kick his legs against the sink and the magnets come undone-the tub doesn't fit snugly in the sink and if the baby wiggles, the tub either comes undone or shifts into an unsafe position.Pros:-lightweight-easy to clean and removeOverall, not the tub for us. However, with the right size sink, I think this tub would be great. We now use the boon collapsible tub and have found it to be a much better fit for our newborn and house.

title: Glad I have this

title: Great newborn tub
author: Alicia H.
comments: Wow!  Our little girl loved this tub in our kitchen sink when she was younger. So easy to clean.  We have already passed it along to some friends for their newborn.

It dries and cleans easily. There's a hole at the bottom to allow the water to run out so baby is always in clean water. Love this product!

title: Love It! Great for Baby and Mommy!

comments: I have 4 kids which means I have had 4 different baby bathtubs and this is my favorite baby bath yet!!! I have found that it  works best for me in the kitchen sink. My daughter has almost outgrown it and it makes me sad to think I will have to start bathing her in a different way.

author: CLO
comments: Absolutely love this tub! It was perfect for my daughter and my sink. I can't imagine bathing her in anything else, especially in those first months. Saved my back and I felt so much more secure having her in a tub that never allowed to fill past a certain point. Must have for babies!

comments: My daughter received this as a baby shower gift. It looks quite odd and cumbersome but VERY practical. It works great in the bathroom sink for new baby. It is not cold to the baby's skin, keeps the baby in shallow bath water without juggling 1 hand to hold and 1 hand to wash. Everyone is confident in bath time! When baby got a little older, we put it in the baby bathtub, again to prevent baby from slipping out of arms. It fits great there too. Once baby can sit up, it should not be used. Great invention! I'm bringing this as a gift for a new mother. I hope she finds it as useful and safe for bathing baby as we did.

title: Fantastic

title: A tub that can't hold any water or fit in my sink

comments: If you are stupid enough to pay what they charge for this piece of trash then be prepared to throw it away and buy another more reasonably priced bath tub. My mother in law was kind enough to buy me a standard infant bathtub for half the price and works very well for all my needs.

I was disappointed because the tub seemed like a great idea for a newborn.

title: Didn't fit any sink

title: this is the most practical portable tub for newborns

title: Great for new baby!
author: Gwammatothree
comments: Interesting way to bathe a tiny one! Fits the kitchen sink well and used with the telescoping faucet is very easy to use. Great shower or new-baby gift =)

title: Limited use. Not practical.
author: ukkospilvi
comments: The Puj Tub is a good in-sink tub to use for a newborn but as your boy or girl grows the tub will soon show its shortened lifespan. We loved it for 2 mos. and then retired it promptly and moved to a different brand/model.If you have plans to use this to the recommended (by the product specs) timeframe, hope for the best but prepare for the worse by either buying a back-up now and storing it or skip this product all together.

title: Loved the Puj tub!
author: MT
comments: My 4 month old granddaughter loved the warmth and comfort of this tub, and my daughter-in-law loved not having to bend over a regular tub.  It doesn't hold much water, though, and it's important to have a supply of warm water near the bath for rinsing.The Puj folds together easily and dries quickly on its Puj Nub hook.  It's also very portable.  It was packed into the bottom of a suitcase for a visit to Hawaii !

title: Unfortunate purchase
author: Moxie
comments: I'm so sad to be writing this poor review. As a new parent, it was my goal to stay budget-friendly and only purchase items that were really going to be useful. After bathing the baby until his cord was healed with just a warm, wet cloth, I decided it was time to bathe him in the sink. It didn't work  at all. I had registered for the Puj Tub, thinking it looked like such a great solution for those of us with limited space, so I didn't hesitate to purchase it. It's now just taking up wall space, an unused disappointment. Here's what I have to say:Pros:* Baby had no complaints.* It warms up quickly and is a soft surface.* Ultimately it takes up less space than the big plastic tubs.Cons:*It definitely does squeak. Loudly. I think it's badly overpriced for what you get.*The magnets don't hold if your sink isn't perfectly shaped. The baby then falls in the "cracks" that are created at the bottom where it's coming apart.* The drain holes vented water all over the edge of the sink and on to my legs and floor. I think this was happening because it was coming apart as stated above.* I couldn't easily get to my baby's back. It's hard to roll side-to-side or to get him to sit up due to the recline (and unstable bottom where it comes apart... seeing a trend?) so I resorted to semi-lifting him out to get his back scrubbed.* The water from the spout ran only on his knee and very little is able to pool, so I'd have to use my hand to fan the water out to get him warmed up/rinsed off. This usually caused more overflow to happen out of the vents.* Due to all the inappropriate bending/coming apart, the structure has started to show wrinkles and creases and isn't holding its shape. Bear in mind that I've only used it 3-4 times.I know bathe the baby with me. I wish I would have saved the money for something that we can actually use.

title: Not worth the money. Not safe.
author: Dawn Matney
comments: I bought this when my daughter was an infant. It did not meet my expectations whatsoever and I returned it. Was just awkward and I didn't feel like my daughter was safe in it. Good idea..but not worth the money, by any means. I don't recommend it.

title: Loved this product!
author: Sunsetbug
comments: After using a traditional sink tub for the first couple of baths, we received this as a gift from a friend and couldn't have been more pleased.We have a pedestal sink in our bathroom and the traditional sink tub for a baby didn't fit, so we had to wash her in the kitchen sink which I didn't care for.  So, when we got this as a gift, we were happy that it fit in our bathroom sink.  Our daughter was 5lbs, 8oz at birth so she was on the smaller side and this tub worked like a charm - we used it until she was 6 months old and transitioned her to our bath tub since she was more mobile and could turn off the water and tried to stand up (started walking at 9 months).This tub is easy as pie, never had a problem with the magnets, and simple to store.  Now, I buy this gift for all my friends expecting babies and they love it.

title: yay puj!
author: charles
comments: This tub is excellent-- it fits in sinks, conserves space, and is a total back saver.  We were able to use this with our baby until she was about 3 months-- at that point, her little legs would unsnap the magnets in the sink.  So if your baby is still little (ie under 3 months), go for it!  It really is great!

title: Hated this product
author: HOOAHRN
comments: I gave it away. I felt so uncomfortable using this in my sink. I felt like I was going to drop my daughter and even at 2 weeks if she would kick, she would open the bottom and reshape the form.

title: Very easy to use
author: Heather A Dolan
comments: Loved this product for it's convenience and use. Though it does not fit in our bathroom sink, it fits nicely in our kitchen sink and has been super easy to use and store. Only complaint would be that the magnets that hold the tub together come undone more easily that I would like.

title: Highly recommended for newborns!
author: walking encyclopedia
comments: This product is a truly great innovation for newborns' bathing. It is comfortable for the baby, thus baby feels safe and is enjoying the bath. My baby could not be happier at bath time. Unlike to conventional bathinettesor the other tools, my newborn son plays with the water, smiles, giggles and simply loves the experience. I purchased this product thinking i would try it and if it makes my baby cry just as much, return it. But, i gave up the conventional bath.This product's material is soft, durable and easy to clean; i keep it behind the bathroom door; it is thin, easy to mount/fold for the bath, but perfect when folded to hold the weight of the baby. I love it and highly recommend for any parent to give it a try for their newly born babies. The kiwi color is super cute!  In just a few seconds you can have the baby in the bath. In minutes you are done with the bath and your baby is happy; at least mine is.

title: Finally !!

The Puj tub would not sit well in our sink (did not look like it was a good fit - kind of floppy!). When I put my baby in it, my baby at 7 pounds was already too big for it. her head was above the sink level so I had to hold it in one hand( she was only 3 weeks old so had no neck control) and try and prevent my screaming baby from hitting herself on the Spout of the sink with the other hand. This might work for bigger sinks with spouts that move out of the way. Waste of money for me.

title: Happy splashing!

comments: The mom to be will thrilled to receive this tub at her baby shower.  I believe she plans to use this when she travels.

title: Best bathtub for smaller babies

comments: I purchased this tub when our 1st baby was born and am so glad I did. She was 4 lbs at birth and we used it for her until she was about 6 months old (could sit up on her own/ turn the faucet off). I loved how easy it was to clean/ dry and baby always loved bath time. She always seemed comfortable and we knew she was safe.Yes, this tub is better if you've got a deeper sink, but after we moved to a home with a smaller sink in her bathroom, it was still fine.This is probably my most recommended new baby purchase and I can't wait to use it again for our next baby.

title: Fantastic Way to Bathe your Baby

Our baby does not slip and slide around in this tub which makes it easy for us to focus on the task on hand.

title: Disappointed
author: Kristy Marshall
comments: Heard great things about this tub, but it did not fit in kitchen sink at all, would not stay closed, sink too big, bathroom sink too small, tried it in a plastic basin, fit, but my baby spit up in it the moment we put him in. Looking for something else :(

title: It is not a tub but I love it!
author: E.W.
comments: I bought this "tub" with the hopes that it would make it easier to wash my boy, and it did. If doesn't fit all the way in the sink but it is meant to be that way. Only a couple of inches of water stay in it without draining, and I liked that because I took my fears away of my boy drowning. I kept the water running while bathing him so he wouldn't get cold. Another thing is that the Puj unfolds flat so I put ot on the side of the washer mashing saving my the trouble of where to keep it until the next bath. My boy outgrow it at 5 1/2 months or 18lb. However I will keep this awesome little tub for my next baby.

title: Must have for caring parents
author: Ilan5555
comments: The simplest way to bath your baby and the most important thing - it's SAFE!!No need to take care of the baby's head.You must try it and you will see.Enjoy!

title: Love love love love this tub!
author: Pop Chips
comments: We live in an apartment, so we were reluctant to buy the traditional baby tub which would take up so much space.  A friend gave us this for our baby shower, and it works wonderfully!  It fits into most sinks, and the bonus is this: we don't have to bend over the adult tub to give baby a bath!  We can comfortably stand up infront of a sink to give our little one his bath.  We've packed this into our carryon suitcase when traveling by plane.  Yup, it's that compact and foldable! For those who complain that the baby 'slides' down the PUJ, I have a solution: just place a little terry washcloth on the PUJ before putting your baby in it.  The roughness of the terry washcloth helps keep the baby from sliding. I can't recommend this tub enough. Just get it -- your back will thank you for it.

title: Favorites
author: Jenettemalaikham
comments: one of my favorite baby items i didn't have with baby #1 but splurged with the second one.  this is just like a piece of Styrofoam, its light and easy to fold up.  it was easy to give my baby a bath in the sink rather than the bathtub.  its definitely a space saver.  as your baby gets older and bigger, they won't fit or start turning on the hot and cold handles in the sink and thats when we had to call it quits with this but it was fun for the baby stage.

title: Good product
author: Sofiya Lulina
comments: It is good to have it at home or especially if you are planing to travel with your little baby. Unfortunately you not gonna use it for long time because the kids are growing so fast and the tub is getting so small so fast...

title: Very Disappointed in the Puj tub
author: E. Friedman
comments: In the weeks prior to my son's birth last month, I took a baby caring class and the teacher highly recommended the Puj tub. So, foolishly, I went ahead and purchased the Puj tub without doing any real research on this product. I say "foolishly" because the money I spent on this product was a complete waste and have since purchased a tub from a different company which I am much more happy with. The advantage of the Puj is that it's lightweight and takes up little room when not used. For me, that's about it. The disadvantage, however, is much more important. I'll start off by saying that I do have a standard sized bathroom sink, yet when I tried bathing my son in it with the Puj, I found that it didn't fit well which, consequently, made bathing my son extremely difficult. Also, the faucet was a big potential hazard and my son almost knocked his head on it several times.

title: we use this as a mat instead of a tub
author: michael kim
comments: The teacher of our newborn parenting class recommended this "tub", so we bought it.  My son screamed and screamed the second he was in it.  I don't understand how you are supposed to actually get water on top of the baby while the baby is in the tub - you put the water in first, make sure the temp is ok, then put the baby in.  I tired heating the bathroom, running the shower so there was soothing white noise - nothing really worked.  After seeing my son scream so many times, I gave up, and started bathing him on the floor on a bunch of towels in a very warm room.  Finally my mom came to visit and suggested just bathing the baby in a very well cleaned kitchen sink!  Works like a charm - we just line the sink with towels and fill it with warm water.  My son loves it!!  Ahhh....  We now use the Puj "tub" as a little landing pad for when we take him out of the bath.  I'm sorry, but I think this is such a waste of money.

title: BACK-SAVER
author: AbijMom
comments: For the first few months, this is the only way I'd ever try to bathe a baby. The Puj Tub saved my back (no kneeling down bending over the edge of the bathtub) and allowed me to focus on baby. My #1 go-to baby shower gift!

title: Short Life
author: Megan White
comments: I loved the fact that this it takes up just a little bit of room which is why I registered for it.  While it was the perfect size for my 6 pound 21 inch long baby... By the time she was 2 months she had already outgrown this tub. She still fits in it but the amount of water that is displaced by her 10 pound body makes it so there isn't enough water to dip the wash cloth in so I have to keep the sink running even though that means wasting so much water.I'd advise buying a baby bath tub that is made to go through stages rather than spending the cash for this short term tub.

title: Especially great for small spaces!
author: jennifer S
comments: We live in a fairly small apartment with minimal storage space. The puj fits nicely in our tiny sink and folds away compactly when we are not using it. The baby doesn't have any complaints either!

title: Eh
author: Gillian
comments: We ordered this product because a coworker raved about it. Unfortunately when it arrived the magnets were on backwards so the tub didn't fold the right way. We're hoping the 2nd try will work out better...

title: Great for newborns to around 5months
author: R
comments: Purchased this item after the bath seat which we purchased with the baby tub became discolored.We looked everywhere for than easy to clean, soft product to wash our little one and bought the Puj Tub.We used it in the baby tub and not in the sink as it is deigned for.Pro:- Easy clean- Dries quick (can hang)- Soft- Easy to put together- Light weightCon:- Its not a tub!!! Its a sink recliner seat- Can only hold infants- Only sits in the sink (we used a small tub but would slip down)This company need to make a product for the Puj to hold in a regular bath tub.Wish i had bought this product earlier.

title: Does not fit every sink.
author: Ana
comments: Wish I could have returned it. It s inconvenient and does not fit neither one of the 4 sinks in my house.

title: Not compatible with all sinks
author: Nkim
comments: I have used this a handful of times with my newborn and if I can give one piece of advice (if you haven't bought this already) is to please don't make the mistake in purchasing this tub. It's not as functional as you think it will be.PROS:- Compact and perfect to store away in small spaces.CONS:- Was not compatible with my kitchen sink. Reading the reviews of others, I believe this works only in smaller sinks (such as the bathroom sink). Because I used it in a larger sink, it kept on coming apart and made for a very messy bath. I tried to fill up my sink with water to prevent it from unfolding but what this caused was the tub to move back and forth which risked my baby almost falling sideways into the sink.- Didn't fully cover my newborn because the holes on the side are meant to get the water to flow out. Therefore you have a newborn that is almost fully exposed, hardly submerged in any water.- Overpriced.Bath times were really stressful because of this non-functional tub. I am now in search of another tub that will be suitable for my newborn.

title: Worked for us
author: Laura
comments: We loved this tub.  Fits in our sink, and love that it dries flat and out of the way (we magnet it to the tub).  We started using at ~3wks, and at 8 wks, our baby now smiles in the bath.  He took some getting used to the procedure, in general, but proved pretty comfortable in this.It's true that the tub only fills ~1/2 way, but this works ok for us.  We keep the tap running to have fresh water cycling, and use a washcloth over his abdomen (see foto).  This, in combination with the curled up position seems to keep him cozy.My only grievances so far:- The hole at the top, which falls just above the baby head when in use (used to hang tub on a hook) sometimes allows for water to leak onto the counter when we're rinsing his hair- It takes a little practice to get him in a position where we can wash his back (I flip him over 1/4 turn onto my forearm, and wash with the other arm)- Sadly, we're expecting him to outgrow this by 3 months ! (currently 12 lbs & 23" at 2 mos) Tho, I don't think it could feasibly get any larger.  And, this will be easy to store away, flat.

title: Not safe and very difficult to use
author: Jessie M Hawthorn
comments: The magnets are weak and the tub constantly opens and my baby slips and her feet get caught. I have been using it since she was born 8 weeks ago and because she can't sit, I have to keep an arm on her always. It makes it very difficult to bathe her. I'm getting a Tummy Tub.

title: First Bath! Success!
author: Christian
comments: It's a cool Tub because it can be used in almost any sink. Preferably bathroom sinks (might prove a bit small in larger kitchen sinks). It's made from a warm soft foam that's anti-fungal, anti-bacterial, hypoallergenic and non toxic. Which, of course, is great for LO's sensitive skin. The foam is sturdy enough to hold baby securely, but soft enough to be comfortable and relaxing for baby during bath time. You can fold it up quick, and then the whole thing unfolds again when you're done so it dries easily and can be stored flat. It's a cool option for sink-bathing babies, and it allows you to stand up during bath time instead of breaking your back hunching over a big bath tub. It's also nice to be able to have both hands free while bathing instead of needing to constantly have one hand on the LO to make sure their secure. It's awesome! The video linked below shows the tub in action. It's of our sons first bath.[...]

title: ok, only works for short time and in certain sinks
author: iberian
comments: PLUS: fits in a sink! Unfolds into a flat thingy for storage and drying! Soft!MINUS: at 5 weeks (and being average size baby) the babe was almost too big for it. The picture on the box is deceiving in that is shows sink faucet high above the tub. In reality most standard sink faucets will be within baby's reach/kick (and most faucets in the bathrooms are stationary). So the faucet is too low and creates more crowding and worry that the baby will hurt himself on it. I ended up covering the faucet with a cloth to make the end 'soft'.The water level will not be very high - I suppose it's a safety feature, but I wish the little one was covered in warm water a little more.In the end I feel it's too expensive for such a short time of use.I transitioned to the Fisher Price Whale tub (love it!) and sort of wish I had it from the beginning. (under $30!)

title: Your baby will love bath time!
author: RanchMom
comments: We've now used this bath through two babies and still love it.  There are so many wonderful features about this tub and very few flaws.PROS1) Does not mold/mildew.  We've had this tub for 2 years and through 2 moves and it still looks almost brand new.  Super easy to clean.2) Easy for storage/travel.  The tub can hang on the back of your bathroom door.  And because it is so lightweight and portable it is easy to take on trips or to Grandma/Grandpa's house.3) Very soft.  Our babies have both been very comfortable in the soft material.  And I don't have to worry about them slipping around and getting into dangerous water.  (Although I would never leave their side during a bath).CONS1) The only con I can think of is that you'll only use this bath for a few months.  Our oldest daughter is a 90th percentile kid and she outgrew the bath within 4 months.  But our 5 month old preemie is still using the tub.2) Price.  Since it only last for a few months some people might not feel it is worth the price when they can find an option that last longer at the same price.  But we didn't feel that way.  It has been a great investment and we'll be able to hand it down to another family when we are done with it since the quality is so good.How to make your baby happy in this tub:Fill the bottom of the tub with warm water that is safe for your baby (use a baby bath temp toy to check).  Also fill a little warm water and baby wash in the pink bath basin you got from the hospital and put 2 washcloths and your hair scrubber (also from the hospital) in the basin.  Place the baby in the puj and place one of the wet, warm washcloths on his/her chest and belly.  Use the soapy water in the bath basin to wash your baby with the other washcloth and hair scrubber.  Enjoy your happy, clean baby.Once our oldest was too big for this tub we moved up to the Dream On Me 2 Position Baby Bather Bath Tub, White which she loves and still uses at 20 months.

title: Great
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Have been using since our twins were newborns, so four months now in standard double sinks.  We also bought the detachable hose that was recommended that stays hooked up in the other sink and stretches to the sink with the puj.  This keeps a constant flow of warm water and I keep a warm wet washcloth over their belly.  Once they move to the bathtub, I will use this flat to save my knees from the tile floor.

title: love Puj
author: C. Grace
comments: I love Puj as a brand.  They are innovative and think of stuff I didn't even know I needed until It tried it!  I love this tub vs. the old school sponge kind.  This seemed a lot more sanitary and gets things less wet and is so easy to store.  I love the green color of the tub. I do wish the magnets were stronger.  My little one seems to always find a way to wiggle one of the magnets loose and thus the tub sometimes gets out of shape while we're bathing.

title: Nice product that saves space BUT...
author: T. Spencer
comments: The puj tub is nice and definitely saves space but it is already to small for my baby and he is not a big boy. I am disappointed that it's already too small for him.  I have to buy something that I can fit into my bathtub so that baby isn't uncomfortable and we have good space for bath time.  I do like the innovation of the Puj and it is nice that it hangs but it definitely is not made for infants up to 6 months.  I wish I had started with something else initially since now I have to make an additional purchase.

title: Why didn't I buy this sooner?
author: Buys Too Much
comments: This is easy to clean, store, and use. If you've got a small sink with lever handles, be careful baby doesn't kick the handles and change the water temperature.

title: Perfect for Pedestal or Kitchen sink
author: Krysta Potter
comments: We do not have bathtub in our house, so I knew I would turn to the sinks to bath the baby. This fits perfectly in both our pedestal and kitchen sink. Since we're also short on storage, this tub is so great because I can put in the closet or under the crib with ease. It's very practical and perfect for small spaces and/or sinks.

title: Simple design is ideal tub!
author: Lauren Ware Fulton
comments: The simple design makes the tub easy to use and easy to clean. I love it. The only complaint I have is that sometimes one side will come undone while I'm bathing my newborn.

title: LOVE THIS!
author: Lori
comments: This is a great product! We live in a small space and I was concerned about having a big plastic baby tub in our one and only bathroom so I bought this. It's definitely one of the best baby product purchases I have made. My 6 week-old son (who generally has a cranky disposition) loves this tub - he hasn't cried once while in it. It's great that its a soft foam so it doesn't get cold and is much more comfortable than a hard plastic tub. And I love that I'm not bending over the edge of the bathtub while trying to wrangle him. I highly recommend this product.

title: Great for a short period of time
author: Paige
comments: I LOVED this tub when I first brought my daughter home from the NICU. She was only 3.5lbs and it worked great to bath her in. It didn't fit our bathroom sink but it did the kitcen. I was able to use it until she hit 10lbs and then it start to unsnap every time I use it. If I had paid full price for this tub I would be mad since most babies will hit 10lbs pretty quickly but I got this on clearance at Target for $9 so wasn't a huge loss for me. If you have a preemie this does work great and I used this until my daughter turned 4 months and it stopped working. I gave this four stars because I really liked this tub when it worked and I am sad I can no longer use it.

title: Great Idea but not as practical as I thought.
author: Patrick
comments: The Puj Tub seemed like a good idea at the time.I did enjoy being able to flatten the tub and hang it up so it could fully dry.  The cushion material was comfortable and sat my baby at a good angle, which I could control by manual placement of the tub in the sink.  She sat well at a lower incline as a newborn and I could increase the incline when she learned to hold her head upright.What I didn't like about the tub was all the water would drain out of the tub and didn't leave a small amount of water to keep her warm during bath time or allow me to dampen a washcloth to wash or rinse.  I used a small bowl or water to solve this problem, not practical.The other feature I didn't like was how close our faucet was to her.  It was a little challenge to get her out and avoid hitting the faucet.  I had to stop using the tub when she would grab the faucet and pull herself towards it.I tried bathing her in our kitchen sink so I could solve some of these problems. The kitchen sink was large enough for me to plug and access water to wet the washcloth and rinse.  This sink also had a faucet I could move out of the way. None of this worked because when I filled the sink with a little water the tub floated with the baby seated, making it hard to bath.

title: Won't stay snapped together!
author: J. Ferguson
comments: I got this tub thinking it would be great! WRONG! It won't stay snapped together causing my baby to slide down. Every time that happens it looses water and he gets cold! The only good things I can say about it is that it drys quick and doesn't take up any room.

title: Great bathtub if you have a standard size sink
author: Tv review
comments: Our baby is 6 months old and we are still using this bathtub.  It works great, and I especially love not having to bend over the tub to give her a bath.  As a caution, this tub will not work unless you have a standard size sink.  It would not fit in our kitchen sink because it is too deep, but works perfectly in our standard square pedestal-style sink (also works in a standard round sink).  The real draw for me was the small amount of space this tub takes up.  I just hang it to dry behind the bathroom door, and I love that it's out of sight.

title: Good concept
author: 808state
comments: Looked like it would be a good idea, but didn't work out as well as I thought it would. It's really soft, so that's good, seemed comfortable enough for baby, but just didn't like it much.  if your sink is too big, won't work, doesn't support itself, need to have the sides of the sink to hold it upright.

title: Worth Every Penny!
author: Erin E. Murtha
comments: We've been using the Puj for 7 months now.  It's perfect.  It fit into our bathroom sink and also the kitchen sink.  We've felt incredibly safe bathing our baby in this tub.  Others have complained that you can't fill the water to baby's arms ... that would be very unsafe!  There is a drain hole that we use to drain out the soapy water and then tilt slightly back to rinse.  I dread the day that we won't fit into it anymore, which is coming soon.  Our little girl is 27 inches and 17 pounds and still fits into this incredible tub.  But, I don't think we have much longer before transitioning into the big bath tub with a baby tub.

title: Waste of money. Wish I'd paid more attention to the negative reviews.
author: Sung
comments: This product must be totally hit or miss. It's too small for my condo's kitchen sink and too large for the bathroom sinks, which all seem to be standard sized. Was hoping for an easy to store tub appropriate for city living, but this does not fit the bill. After just two uses with my one-month old, I went out and bought a real baby tub that she can grow with. Because of the way this is product is designed, the water drains out the bottom while the baby is sitting in it. The magnets are too weak to sufficiently hold the product together, which causes the water to drain out. The Puj basically allows you to give a sponge bath in a sink. The baby isn't sitting in any water after less than a minute. You have to keep refilling the Puj from a basin or sponging off your baby with wash clothes dampened in another sink. That is unless you want to keep the water in the sink you are using running constantly, which isn't the safest in an apartment setting where you can't control the water temperature. Definitely think twice about this product. It's not worth it if you have to immediately go out and buy another more traditional baby tub.

title: Fits tiny bathroom sink, fits large kitchen sink!
author: Jessica N.
comments: We registered for the blue Puj Tub and received it a few weeks ago. I was nervous that it might not fit in our smallish bathroom sink. The bathroom is easy to keep warm so we really wanted to bathe our newborn in there.It turned out to fit perfectly in the small bathroom sink! He might not fit under the faucet for more than a couple months before needing to put the Puj in our kitchen sink.It's extremely easy to connect the magnets and disconnect to hang up and dry. I'm so pleased with how little room it takes up. We simply didn't have the space to store those large whale tubs.Another tip!! When your baby has outgrown bathing in the sink, you can put the Puj under him in the large adult bathtub as a soft, grippy surface for him to sit on!

title: Better form than function
author: SuperD
comments: I thought this would be a great solution to save space in our small apartment. I loved that it could store flat. It was also available in a beautiful bright blue. This worked OK when our son was just a newborn, but he outgrew it around 3 months. It also doesn't fit perfectly in the sink or hold much water because of the angle and holes on the bottom. It's awkward to support the baby while trying to get to the water underneath him. Our baby isn't a huge fan of baths in the Puj. I am now going to look for a more traditional tub that he can grow with.

title: Loved It!
author: John Johnson
comments: We live in a small apartment and needed something for our sink. This works like a charm. We used it for my son until he outgrew it. Then we loaned it to a friend. Then we used it when our daughter came along. We love it...still have it even though we don't use it. Pricey, but worth it to us.

title: Thanks
author: Francisco A Pineda R
comments: Everything Was fine thanks, all the ítems arrived no timé and complete, the ítem is beautiful. . . . .

title: Wish I had it with my 1st child !
author: Crystal
comments: its a little pricy but worth every penny. I used it for my son from day one until he was about 7 months. Its very light weight and flexible. It has holes so the water falls right through and is supper soft. I would store it on the side of the sink in the bathroom and it never took up much space like the other baby tubs.I never had any problems with it at all.

title: My favorite baby purchase
author: AZ
comments: I got the Puj tub based on some of the reviews in here and I have to say this is my favorite buy. Its so portable (we travel a lot), super easy to clean and really simple to use. It adjusts to different sink sizes too. If you need one bath essential, I would say this is it.

title: perfect for slippery babies
author: Maggie O
comments: We love this tub.  It did break (one of the magnet 'button' things came off) and I contacted the company & they shipped a new one really quickly.  The tub is great for a slippery little baby-keeps them nicely propped up.  Baby loved it too.

title: Love the puj!
author: J. Shackman
comments: We received this as a gift for our newborn daughter. It is lightweight and fits nicely in our kitchen sink. I could see how it might not work for people with small sinks though. It also fits nicely in our infant to toddler plastic tub before she is big enough to use that. I like how this tub cradles her and she seems to be very comfortable. It holds a small amount of water, enough to cover her thighs and bottom but not so much that I'd worry about it a covering her face even if she slipped in it. I would definitely Not leave an infant unattended in this though, as with any infant tub. I do think the price is kind of steep for a product that has limited use, but for us it works well.Update: my 12 week old has pretty much outgrown this, so it definitely has limited use. Not sure it's worth the price because of this but was still definitely nice when we did use it!

title: Couldn't make it work
author: k8cdi
comments: I really liked the space-saving nature of this tub, but unfortunately can't figure out how to make it work for my baby. It doesn't fit in either my bathroom or kitchen sinks; one is too shallow and the other too small. I agree with other reviewers that the water does not go high enough and baby gets cold. The magnets are not very strong if pressure is applied. I tried a few times and gave up, now I am bathing her directly in the sink. I'm disappointed and would not recommend. A folding plastic bath seems like a better alternative to those of us tight on space.

title: A "Must Have for Baby" in our household!
author: KMF
comments: I love this tub. Wish we had this when our little one was 3 weeks old! We bought this tub when our girl was about 2 months old & 10 lbs. We just stopped using it around 7.5 months/8 months 17lbs (primarily as she can sit up great in a regular bathtub)The reason we love this tub:1) It did not require 4 hands! When you first have your little one...they can be a bot squirmy, slippery, and limp in your arms! This tub allowed me to wash our girl with ease & without the aid of the hubby needing to help2) Simple & compact: it is so nice to whip this out & put away with no hassles (big tubs are bulky & need more space. With lots of baby items around the house, like a swing, bouncer, walker etc...it's nice to have something compact & useful)3) Quick rinses: The beach is just a quick walk for us so we are always getting sandy & salty. It is so easy to use this tub for a quick rinse where clean water is replenished easily (when you are rinsing, the water begins to over flow out. This is also great just for regular baths where you want to rinse off the soapy water on your little one. The bigger baby tubs need to be drained & refilled.4) Stable: It was completely stable in our standard double kitchen sink. (We could not use it in our bathroom sinks which I was ok with)Only negative I would note is it won;t fit in all sinks as noted by other reviews & the price is a little high...but still, this was a necessity in our home.We also have the baby "Whale Tub" which was challenging her first few months. We did begin to use it off/on as she got older as she really enjoyed the water & kicking her legs. But we still loved the convenience & ease of the Puj if we needed a quick bath (due to time or the little one being grouchy!). I have given away most our little one's items that she has outgrown...but the puj tub I am holding onto just in case we have another!

title: UNSAFE and awkward to use
author: Rae
comments: I found this item to be highly unsafe.  Put my little guy in it (he's a newborn) and found he rolled too easily side to side.  It offers no side to side stability or protection.  After nearly bumping his head off the side of the sink I said the hell with it and threw the piece of junk out.  I didn't even bother to try it in the bathroom sink because you could tell just looking at the set up it wouldn't work.  You can tell the whole system is going to be sloppy at best just by looking at the pictures.  Don't waste your money on this.

title: I love this thing.
author: Gema
comments: My daughter is now 3.5 months and she has had every bath in her Puj right in the kitchen sink. It works great. It holds just enough water to keep her warm and with the 3 drain holes, I just keep the water running the whole time she is in it so the water doesn't get cold and I don't have to worry about trying to get the right temperature again when I'm ready to rinse her off. It is very soft; it is very much like those pool mats but much thinner. I hang it on a hook on the back of the bathroom door when not in use and hang her hooded towel right over it. It is wonderful to stand up straight to bathe her and to not have to mess with putting several towels in the sink to make a soft place for her like I had to do with my son 14 years ago.Probably wouldn't work in most bathroom sinks unless you have an unusually large sink in the bathroom.

title: Overall a good buy
author: Jjmay
comments: We got this tub when I was pregnant, and I am really glad we had it when our baby came home from the hospital. It was a great place to put her when she could only do sponge baths, and also worked great when she could get wet. It is lightweight and portable, and we have used it easily on many trips. Only downside is that some sinks we used were not the right size so it took a little tinkering to get the tub to fit. If you have a deep circle sized sink, do not buy this. It will not fit AT ALL! That is the only type of sink we couldn't get it to fit. Our daughter is about to turn 4 months old and is about to grow out this tub, so it doesn't last for a long time, but well worth the first few months.

title: Great infant tub!
author: Jonathan Knutsen
comments: This tub was a gift from my mother. At first, my wife and I were skeptical but after using it, we loved it! This made bathing our daughter so much easier. It fits perfectly in the sink and makes it easy for one person to bath her.  Even as a newborn, she easily was supported almost completely by the tub! Of coarse, you should always keep one hand on your child especially while bathing but this tub is so supportive you really don't have to worry about them slipping or falling over or anything! She seemed to be very comfortable in this and it's very easy to clean. What more could you possibly want? The only downfall is how quickly they grow out of it as this is a sink tub and doesn't really work in the bath.

title: Not compatible with all sinks
author: Rebecca
comments: I did lots of research to make sure I get the right tub. This tub came high recomended and after I read the reviews I got it. They claim it will fit most sinks, even smalle sinks but that definitely is not the case. My bathroom is pretty big with a standard size sink and this did not fit. Even if it did, it seems like it would be very uncomfortable for the baby. I ended up buying a big bathtub that takes up a lot of space but one that I'm happy with.

title: Easy To Use and Store- Good product
author: student
comments: We've been using this tub for 3 months (from birth 8 lbs 5 oz. 21 inches to current 13 lbs 23 inches) and our son still fits well in the Puj.  He may grown out it in in length within another month or so however.  We've used this tub in our large kitchen sink, and like the way it fits better than in our more shallow bathroom sinks, mostly due to the position of the faucet in proximity to our baby's face/head being closer in the smaller bathroom sink.  This tub drains well, keeping clean water circulating, is comfortable for our baby, as well as comfortable for us to stand and bath him.  We've had need to bath our son in the bathtub with out the puj tub on occasion when we've been away from ours, and it's been much more comfortable for us to stand at the sink and use our Puj than to kneel over the bath tub.  It dries quickly and hangs flat which is perfect for our storage needs.  It seems expensive for a piece of foam and a few magnets, but I suspect you pay for the design and uniqueness of this tub compared to what else is out there.  We've been pleased with this purchase and have given a few as gifts.  Wish it would last longer as our baby groww, so we could use it longer.

title: Perfect!
author: earthmamma7
comments: We just started using this with our newborn 2weeks ago. It fits perfectly in our kitchen sink making it very easy to use. Unfortunately it didn't work in our bathroom sink which is smaller, because the faucet was too low. I would recommend this product as long as you have a sink with taller faucets. That said, it's a great tub that is soft for baby and fills up to the perfect water level. It dries really nice and can be stored anywhere out of sight, very convenient for our smaller home, less clutter! it forms to the perfect shape to hold her and support her during bath time making things easy for us. I LOVE this tub. Not sure how long we will be able to use, but our little 7lb babe looks as though she'll fit for at least a few months.

title: So great!
author: Abby Lia
comments: When this arrived (before baby was here), I thought it was huge and cumbersome and a big waste of money...BUT once I started actually using it I was thrilled with the purchase.  It claims to be able to fit in any sink...and while this is true, I have found that it fits better in some sinks than others.  There are drainage holes on both sides and on the end so you can just leave the water from the faucet running and not worry about it overflowing or getting too close to baby's airways (of course, you still worry...but it's a nice feature).  I like that it can be completely flat for storage.  Baby loves her baths in the puj!

title: Perfect Infant tub but like most things for baby you will only use for a few months
author: redping
comments: When we first had our son this is the only tub we had. It had recently come out at the time. I can't imagine a better designed infant tub.Things that I love about this tub:- I can assemble it with one hand while holding baby with the other.- It has a hand hole that I can use to hand it on the hook that we have on the bathroom door.- The hold in bottom lets just enough water in but not too much to cause fear of drowning.- We have a circular sink and it fit perfectly snug in it and my baby always seemed secure.Things that I did not like:- Let's be honest, we only used this tub for 2-3 months and then we had to get a larger one. Our son was on the large size, but I was surprised by how fast he outgrew it.- They are in arms reach of the faucet handles. Once he started getting grabby (again surprisingly early) I feared that he would scald himself.Bottom line, this is a great product for what it is intended for, just don't be like me and think that it will take your child through the time when they can sit up on their own.

title: Love this
author: Chubblewub
comments: We got this for our baby and I love it. We use it in our kitchen sink.  It doesn't fit every type of sink and you do need a faucet that has a long neck bu if you do, you will love it.  It's super lightweight and our baby loves it.  It collapses so you can store it anywhere which is nic compared to the bulky plastic ones you see everywhere. I'm not sure how long we will be able to use this for our son (he is almost 12 weeks) but right now, it still fits him.  We love it.

title: Priceless - for the first four months
author: Amanda Levine
comments: We bought the PUJ after returning a standard baby tub when we realized we had nowhere to store it (only 1 bath/shower). It fits both of our sinks wonderfully and is easy to set up, even with one hand. Our daughter only used it for her first few months (maybe 4?) but it was totally worth not having to reach so far to get to her, bend over (c-section), etc., and it hung right on the wall out of the way.One reviewer said this was difficult to fill with the baby in it. WHY WOULD YOU DO THAT ANYWAY??! Babies should never be put directly under water coming out of a tap when you don't know what the temperature is going to be. We filled it up, plopped her in it, and then had a small bowl of the same temp. water on the side for dipping a washcloth and pouring. I would recommend this to any parent. Priceless!(After she grew out of the PUJ, we bought the Flexibath Foldable tub and are extremely happy with that, too.

title: This tub can be a safety hazard
author: Khun Nali
comments: I'm giving it an extra star for clever design, otherwise it would be a 1 star.I got this for my baby shower, and I was really excited because we live in a tiny house (730 square feet) which means that every inch of space is carefully thought out, and every item that comes into the house has to fit somewhere.  We registered for the tub because of its slim profile and easy storage.It's wonderfully compact, however there are some concerning problems with it.  First unless you fill the sink all the way up with water underneath the tub, the baby gets cold.  I cover him with a wash cloth on his tummy to keep him warm, but that isn't enough.  Second, when you do eventually fill the sink up with water underneath the tub, the tub starts to float away.  In order to keep the tub and my baby from tipping over and sending him head first into the water I have press down firmly on the tub WHILE washing a squirming baby.  Last, the baby doesn't have much room to stretch his legs, which means that it is almost impossible to clean his little nether regions without a serious struggle.Today, I dragged myself to Babies R Us and bought a huge, ugly plastic tub that has a more baby-ergonomic shape.  It feels like the damned thing takes up my entire kitchen, but at least I'm not worried that my baby will freeze or drown.

title: Convenient for parents, safe for baby
author: Velika
comments: This tub is not only convenient for parents (and gentle on their backs!) but also safe for baby. It fits any sink we've tried well (we've traveled with it to many countries - it fits well in a suitcase - either opened flat or folded in a corner, filled with clothes to maintain its shape). Our baby felt very safe in it and loved it as did we.

title: Worked ok for about 2 months....
author: V. P.
comments: first off, let me say that I didn't get this tub on Amazon...i found it in the clearance aisle for 1/4 of the price at a big box chain store, so i snatched it up. It didn't fit in my bathroom sink so we had to bathe the baby in the kitchen... No big deal.My daughter LOVED bathtime in this, so I was very thankful I got this tub. It was easy to use, easy to clean & very easy to store (without taking up a lot room like other baby tubs do)The problem came when my daughter hit about 11 lbs and 22 inches (about 3.5 months). The tub started to collapse because the sink was TOO big, so it couldn't support the foam and the weight of a small infant.Now, I just let her sit in the kitchen sink & I've donated this to a friend who wanted to try it out.All in all, I wouldn't get this again, I would have stuck with my original registry ask of the Prince Lionheart washpod. I want something I can use for more than 2 months.

title: This tub is Fabulous
author: jaybird
comments: This tub is genius -- a must have for any mom.  Saves your back, your knees.. the list could go on. PLUS, it's super easy to maneuver one handed, which is certainly an added bonus with a baby in the other!

title: love it.  Worth every penny.
author: Princess hunnypants
comments: This is seriously my favorite baby product.  It was such a life saver after having an emergency c section.  Bending was so hard after surgery I couldn't have imagined having to use one of those bulky big tubs or my own bathtub after surgery.  Thank goodness I didn't have to because I bought the Puj. My son also loves it.  He thinks it's funny to rub his legs on it and make a squeaky sound.

title: LOOK AT YOUR SINK!
author: JJ Palmer
comments: Everyone who said you have to have a certain type of sink is completely right. I feel very bad because I got this as a shower gift per my registry but it just doesn't work. Go look at your sink and imagine a typical newborn laying in it. If it already seems pretty snug with a baby alone then it certainly won't work with this thing in it. The idea is great but you need one of those modern round deep sinks, not the standard home depot deal with the little stubby faucet. The baby would not be submerged at all and the faucet would be so close to his body it would pose a hazard. I tried putting it in the kitchen sink but that sink is too big and the puj floats awkwardly around. Dang.

title: Awesome if you have a premie
author: Amazon Customer
comments: My daughter was just under 5 pounds when she was born. Everything was too small for her. She is a squirmer too so this bathtub is a lifesaver. Not good for larger babies but defintely worth the investment if you have a smaller baby.

title: Mother of four, first newborn tub we love.
author: mamidecinco
comments: We bought this for our fourth baby.  I was looking for a comfortable tub that would not smell of mold after a few uses and that my husband could use with our newborn.  This tub fit the bill!  I was hesitant to purchase it because I know how quickly babies outgrow things, but it was worth it.  In the past my husband had a hard time bathing our babies when they were newborn because with the soap they would slip around too much for them, but this kept the baby in place.  Our baby has loved his bath's since day one!  Only reason I gave it four stars was because he just now weighs 16 lbs and has officially outgrown it...the product says 17 lbs.  But we got a good four 1/2 months out of it!

title: quite functional!
author: R&A
comments: I really like this tub! My little girl is 2 weeks old, and she has absolutely no neck control right now. With this tub tucked into our sink, she fits really easily, with her neck and back well supported and up out of the water. We also like that it's quick and easy to drain out the soapy water when you're ready to refill it with clear water--we just push down one of the bottom corners until all the water drains out. The fold that's created at the bottom of the tub once installed in the sink makes it easy to run the new water to check the temperature before we move the faucet back over into the tub. We do have a tall faucet, though, so I'm not sure this would work for everyone.The flat shape is very convenient for storing (right now it just tucks into the back of our towel rack in the bathroom) and for traveling (we live overseas, so we love that it fits conveniently into a suitcase or a shipping box).We have a pretty small sink, so the tub creates a small, snug space for the baby to securely rest. We'll probably move this into the kitchen sink once she's a little bit older and needs more space. I only wish that the tub fit into square sinks just as well as it fits into our oval sink.

title: awesome
author: Lylah's mom
comments: Truly great. fits in sink perfectly. The only change I would make is adding a hole for water to drain.

title: LOVE the Puj!
author: Miyabi382
comments: When I was creating my baby shower registry, I knew we didn't have much bathroom (or apartment!) space for a large baby bathtub. At the time the Puj tub had just come out - it looked handy and sounded like a good solution to my tiny bathroom problem. I was lucky enough to recieve it at my shower, and I can say with confidence, that it is one of the best baby product choices I've made! My little girl is now 4 months old and STILL uses the Puj in our bathroom sink. She's very comfortable in it and it's held up well through our daily uses. I hung a suction hook in the shower so I could hang up the Puj (since it goes flat) to dry, and we haven't had any problems with it so far. Definitely a smart purchase for anyone who needs a compact infant tub!

title: Best baby tub!
author: Page
comments: This tub is great!  I have used it since my daughter weighed 7 pounds.  You have to occasionally nudge them to keep them from tipping over but it's worth the conveinance this tub offers.  It works in both round and square sinks.  The ones in my bathroom and kitchen both worked great! The do outgrow it pretty fast though and when they start getting strong they can kick it and pop the magnets which opens the tub.

title: Would not buy again
author: Philly Mom
comments: While this is a nice looking bathtub, it does require a specific size sink, which we don't have. Even between three sinks in the house, it doesn't work well with any of them. If you don't have the right sink its extremely difficult to bathe a new born alone. I am now looking for a different tub!

title: Magnets come undone
author: Sunset Slacker
comments: I've been using the Puj tub for 3 1/2 weeks now. I love being able to stand up to wash my baby in the sink. I also love the compact nature of the product. Space is a serious issue in my home & we were able to hang it on a hook in the shower. I'm very happy with that aspect. As others have stated, it s not compatible with some sinks, which I have found. My bathroom sink is shallow, which causes the tub to move during bathing. Also, the faucet is too low & my baby gets her arm or knee pinned under it, which I don't like.  The biggest issue is that LO gets kicking and the magnets that hold the tub folded together comes undone & she slips down. It's hard enough to manage a slippery baby without your tub coming apart on you. I still use it since I don't have room for a big plastic tub, but def not a perfect product.

title: Great for newborns!
author: April
comments: My son was a big baby, so he outgrew his Puj tub pretty quickly, but I'd still recommend it to anyone and buy it again myself.  It was so nice to be able to bathe him safely in the sink when he was so small and slippery.  I especially recommend it for first time parents who find the idea of bathing their 'breakable' little bundle completely daunting.  We left the water running into the tub the whole time, which he loved, and the Puj has little holes which prevents it from filling up very full.  The water was always the perfect temperature and never soapy because it cycled through so nicely.  For urban/apartment living, we also loved how easy the Puj was to store.  No big bathtub to find a place to hide.  We just hung it on a hook and let it dry.  Overall, I highly recommend this product and look forward to using it again with our next little babe.

title: Fits in the Sink? not in all the styles... not in mine
author: Adriana Ramos Hinojos
comments: I was really happy with the product UNTIL I used it. It doesn't work, it opens in my sink, loosing its shape. It is just BAD and expensive, a waste of money!

title: magic
author: chris nj
comments: Mother of three. Love the tub. It's not meant to be used longer than maybe 4 to 5 mos but it's a great tub. Saves a lot of time with easy fold with magnets. Can't complain about it because after u r done, u can just hang dry, takes up so little space. Designed to be used in standard sized bathroom sinks. It's even better if u have a higher faucet but if u don't, it still serves it's purpose. Soft material does not stain or have mildew build up like some tubs can even if u clean them right. Love the fact that I can run the water low the whole bath time and it drains with such ease. Makes me feel like I can clean more thoroughly because I'm constantly using the fresh water which u can't do with a traditional tub. I hated emptying out the other tubs which takes forever to rinse the baby after the soap. It's not a soaking tub so for those with long babies, might want to place a nice size wash cloth over the belly to keep the little one warm. Love the fact that u can handle with one hand while holding the baby. It's still being used, went from my sister to her friend and now another mom in need. Very durable.

title: Miracle bath!
author: JWLS
comments: This tub was a miracle tub for us!  First of all, we live in Germany and have VERY SMALL sinks... not a problem with the Puj Tub.  I had a c-section and this allowed me to be upright while bathing my infant.  Great for post section.  ALSO, I am able to bath my infant at the same time that my older children play in the bathtub.  Highly recommend!

title: Buyer beware: You have to have the exact right size sink and faucet for this to work.
author: tchaubela
comments: I really reaaalllly wanted to love this tub. I loved that it was space-saving and you could put it in the sink to minimize back pain. I am due in 6 weeks and didn't even have to try it out with my baby in it to know that it wouldn't work. This thing was too big for my bathroom sink (which is an average-sized sink), and too small for my kitchen sink.  Pay special attention to the picture it shows to advertise this...notice how the faucet comes up pretty high? Maybe my sink is abnormal...but not only was it too small, but the faucet was way too low, hanging RIGHT over the very edge of the tub. There would be no possible way for me to fit a baby in this tub AND have room between the baby and the faucet to gather water with a washcloth. The tub doesn't hold any water, so baby would be very cold. I think that with the perfect sized sink and perfectly shaped faucet, this tub could work...but with me it was a total bust. Really disappointed :(  Now off I go to go buy some big ugly bulky thing that I will have to put in my tub and bend over and hurt my back :(

title: Awesome
author: Amy Beth
comments: The little one is not here yet, but the tub is much thicker then the alternative foam sink tub and uses strong magnets instead of cheap velcro. It is great quality, easy to store in our shower, fits the sink perfectly. Awesome little space saver, and very safe.

title: great bathing option!
author: t mueller
comments: Was a little worried when I received this tub that it wouldn't fit in our sinks properly (based on some of the previous reviews). Happily, the Puj fits just fine in our sink. We use the kitchen sink - a pretty standard two-sided rectangle sink and it works great. Not sure what anyone else is having a problem with in their square/rectangle sinks. Have been using this tub since our baby's second week, and love it. Nice and soft, kind of deep for smaller babies, but we just fold up a kitchen towel and place it in the bottom to boost our baby up a bit. Great to not have to lean over or kneel to bathe baby. Love that it flattens out, wipes dry, and is easily stashed in a closet.

title: Perfect After C-Section! Kinder to Your Knees!
author: CLaM1225
comments: SUMMARY: Many baby products out there are gimmicks, but it you have concerns about C-Section pain/scars or have bad knees/hips and/or a higher tub wall to reach over, then the Puj Tub is a GREAT product to get you through the first few months of your child's life. The material was so super-easy to clean and way more durable than I thought it was going to be--and it helped the C-Section healing process so much--that we packed it away just in case we have another child in the future.BACKGROUND: After my first C-Section, I didn't have any steps to worry about and our tub walls were rather low, so getting on my knees to give my son a bath wasn't so bad. (It wasn't so good, either. We had an infant tub, but he would slide all over the place, and we could never get it in the "right" spot in the bathtub where it would be comfortable.)When I had to have a C-Section with my second son, I had a ton of stairs to contend with and a tub with very high walls, neither of which made washing the baby very easy or very safe. Just getting him in and out of the bath was a painful experience! Then came the Puj Tub (thanks to seeing it on the Ellen show).REVIEW: What a difference! It was easy and efficient to give my son a bath, he had absolutely no fear of the water (unlike my first son in his baby bathtub), and neither my knees nor my C-Section scar gave me any trouble. I also enjoyed the bath experience more because I was up close to my baby and better able to control where I dumped the cup or how he played and interacted in the bath. When it was time to move to the big tub, I was actually disappointed!USE: For a regular bath, I would test the water and fill up my sink until the water covered the bottom of the Puj, then place my son in it. This worked well, keeping him warm and wet and making it easier to bathe him. For quick rinses, I'd test the water, wet the tub, and then stick him in with the water still running. There was enough room between the tub and the faucet where my sink wouldn't fill up and cause a mess.CONSUMER CONCERNS: There was a learning curve in getting it to sit right in my sink. I'm not very mechanical, and it did take me an extra few seconds to figure out the magnets, but that's probably my own failing. Once I figured it out, I didn't have any trouble setting everything up. My husband never liked it, but he was against the idea of baby baths in sinks, anyway. He thinks/thought a sink bath is/was awkward. (He's also a pretty big guy.)I also wasn't sure the material would hold up (or hold the baby), but I was pleasantly surprised by how durable the foam is. It cleaned up well, dried quickly, didn't grow mold or attract mildew, and bounced back to near-flat for easy storage.The size and/or weight requirements may be a problem for some. If you have a rather large baby (mine was a peanut!) or a rather small sink, then the Puj Tub will have limited use for you. As your child gets bigger, s/he will probably outgrow both the tub and sink more quickly than s/he would an infant tub. I was able to use the Puj Tub until my son was well over six months, keeping him secure while still being able to reach all the important parts, but I don't think that's the case for everyone. Be warned that you may still have to buy an infant/toddler tub in the future.Lastly, I made a mess the first few times I used the tub--mostly because I couldn't find the right balance between standing water and running water. If you have a sink with a large vanity or counter, then that's probably the one you want to use. I did have to bathe him once in my friend's pedestal sink, and it worked rather well, but I was "good" at the Puj Tub method by then.

title: A Necessity for Newborns!
author: Alice In Wonderland
comments: I really recommend this PUJ tub for any new mom. It fit snugly in my bathroom sink as well as our pedestal sink downstairs. I would cover the faucet with a washcloth and use an elastic hairband to secure it. This would prevent me from accidentally 'on instinct' turn on the faucet as well as protect my baby as she became older and more cognizant of the faucet!We used this tub until she was about 6-7 months old! My daughter is on the smaller side so she fit in the PUJ for a while and I preferred it to the larger tub we got for when she is older (and using now). Start with this PUJ and then get the Whale of a Tub -- it's really the best one out there and cheap too.

title: Worth it!
author: Jack's Momma
comments: This is a GREAT alternative to a plastic bathtub.  We just didn't have the storage space for a large tub, so I decided to try the Puj.  It has worked out great so far and fits perfectly in our bathroom sink (pretty sure it's a standard size)! Our son is 4 months old, and has been bathed in this since day one.  He seems very comfortable in it and we can adjust the recline.  The foam dries quickly and its very easy to clean.  It lies flat which makes it easy to store in a linen closet.  I haven't had any issues with the magnets not holding the shape of the tub.  Now that our little one is hell bent on sitting up, it is time to retire the Puj :(  Looks like we are moving on to a bath seat!

title: Ok...for the first two months
author: Kelly Rae
comments: I bought this tub and, at first, loved it!  It fit perfectly in the sink (kitchen sink) and collapsed and fit neatly away on a hook in the bathroom when bath time was over.  My baby was small (6 lbs. at birth) and by the second month, the magnets that hold the tub together didn't hold and the water (and my daughter) started to fall out of the tub.  I finally gave in and purchased a plastic tub that we use in the bathtub.  Now that she is sitting up fairly well on her own now, I think I'm going to try out a bath ring that suction cups to the bottom of the tub.

title: Limited usage, but great while it lasts
author: Katharine
comments: I now have a 7 mo old baby girl, who outgrew her puj tub before 3 months or so.Pros:- excellent for newborn baby.  It's soft, it cradles well, and the water is shallow for a newborn.  My baby was so relaxed the first time she got a bath, she pooped in it.  :)- easy to use with one hand, lightweight- cleans easily- MOST IMPORTANTLY, it saves a new mom's back, who is still recovering from a tear or a c-section!! Also, who wants to crouch on the floor hunched over a bathtub at this time?- allows bath-time to be a one-person dealCons:- does not fit all sinks.  I had to use mine in fairly standard sinks, the type you'd get with contractor grade materials.  Nothing fancy.  In another bathroom with a semi-raised sink with an oval opening of about 16x14 in, it couldn't fit well, and the faucet got in the way.  Kitchen sinks don't work, as they are too big to hold the puj tub effectively closed- when baby gets more active,  the feet push and stretch out the foot end of the tub, causing water to run out- also the head part is not that well supported.  When my baby arched, her head almost hits the sink.- water seems really shallow as baby gets bigger.  I worry about baby getting cold.  Again, my use was nowhere near 6 monthsOverall, it's a great tub for a short period of time.  If it cost $10, I'd be giving it 5 stars, but at $40, I would think twice. Much more worth it for a small baby, but if you have a 99% like mine, be prepared to stop using it very soon! :)

title: Concept is great, delivery needs work
author: A Teacher
comments: I bought this tub for my second son because I used one of those cheap sponge things to bathe my first son in the kitchen sink.  I thought this would be great because I could place the baby in the sink and it would cradle him while I bathed him, and I wouldn't have to hold him up at an awkward angle.  Well, first of all, the first time I put it in the sink I realized it was not large enough to fill the sink, which became a serious problem later on.  When you fill this tub, you have to fill the sink almost to the top, otherwise, the water leaks out the holes into the bottom of the sink, and the baby sits on a tiny puddle of water with no water surrounding him at all - and he FREEZES!  Plus, the tub is in the way, so you can't get your washcloth down into the water to get it wet so you can wash him.  You either need to fill the sink all the way, or leave the water running - which presents the problem of scalding or freezing the baby when the water runs too cold or too hot at first.  I chose to fill the sink all the way - which leads to a whole new SERIOUS issue -- the tub FLOATS!!!!!!!!!!  I placed it in the sink securely, filled the sink, checked the temp, undressed my baby on the kitchen island right next to the sink, and when I turned to put him in -- the tub was floating on top of the water!  I had to fight to get it positioned properly to put my son in the water -- if I set him down wrong and he was too low in the seat, when I lifted him to reposition him, the tub would float and I'd have to fight with it all over again.Now, fortunately, my baby LOVES the water, but he wiggles (like any baby would) - especially when I pour water over his head.  This added to the fact that it is impossible to position a baby properly in this tub because it floats up the second the baby's weight is lifed -- well, when he wiggles, he slides down in the tub - He is in the 90th percentile and so, is larger than most babies, so I can only imagine the sliding down would be even worse with a smaller baby.
