My son has slipped down under the water more times that I can count in this thing - actually slipped right down, head under the water!!!  This is a serious safety issue.  Obviously, I was right there and pulled him out immediately, so he was never in any danger - but how can you design a tub that makes it impossible to position a baby without floating up in the water, increasing the baby's risk of falling out of the tub and putting him in danger of drowing?!?!  By the end of the bath, my son usually slides down to the edge of the tub, then wiggles up when I rinse his hair, causing the tub to slip up behind him and literally 'float away' so I am left holding my son up at an awkward angle while I finish his bath and the tub floats behind him and hits him in the back of the head repeatedly.  The only way to place the baby in the tub is to hold him in one hand over the water(he weighs 15 pounds at 4 months - so this is NOT easy to do)  while pushing the tub down to the bottom of the sink with the other hand, and then sort of "dropping" him down into the tub so his bottom hits the tub just right, weighting it down so it won't float.  How ridiculous is that?!  And if you don't land the baby in the tub just right, it tilts in the water, throwing him off balance and - eventually, as he wiggles, underwater.....So, you have to pick the baby up to reposition him - but the second you lift him up even a little, the tub floats up again, so you need to do the whole awkward dance of holding it down while you hold the baby up so he doesn't go underwater all over again!Very disappointed.  No, I have not bought a new tub -- this thing was expensive, so I intend to use it until my baby can sit up, but not because I like it.  I just don't want to go out and spend more money on another tub.  I like the idea of the tub, but the implementation of a good concept needs some serious, serious work.  I can't believe how this tub puts babies in such risk of drowning.  I worry about first time parents with this thing.  I was fortunate to have the experience of bathing my firstborn in a sink while holding him up.  I can't imagine what would have happened if this was my first baby and the tub slipped up behind him while I was bathing him and floated away -- the thought of an inexperienced parent trying to fight with this tub and needing to hold a squirming, slippery newborn up in the water with a big white tub floating up behind him without being prepared for that possibility makes me shudder.  I would NEVER give this as a gift to a friend - it's like saying "I hope your baby drowns."  I guess the one plus is, my baby will never be afraid to dunk his head underwater....he's been dunked underwater more times than I can count with this thing.  I really wanted something that would make baby's bath time more enjoyable and less frustrating.  I guess it makes for an interesting bath experience...not exactly what I was looking for, but, there's certainly never a dull moment for either of us with the puj tub around.

title: Disappointed...
author: A. Kent
comments: Not that impressed w/this item.  Does not fit too well in our sinks. We have standard sinks and the fit is just not great.  It was okay for a brand new baby but once my, at birth 9lb, baby girl was a month or so old it was just not cutting it.I think there are better items out there.  This is my second child and I have now went back to my ODD's hard plastic baby tub.  It does take up a lot more room then this but I can get a good amount of warm water in the old plastic tub and DD seems to enjoy it much more then in this thing.

title: piece of garbage
author: hp
comments: This thing (Puj Tub) is the biggest piece of garbage ever.  The position the tub puts the baby in is very bent over to the point the baby is very uncomfortable.  Unless the sink is shaped exactly right, the tub will unfold.  It is very hard to position the baby to get the faucet in the correct position.  Any movement the baby makes, I am concerned he will be injured by how close the faucet is when the tub is in place.  Do not waste your money.

title: Wife: "I love this tub" + Working sink dimensions
author: RJD
comments: This is the ONLY tub we've found that doesn't cause our son to scream his head off when we give him a bath...  And we've tried LOTS of tubs.  It is both relaxing for the parents and the baby.  (We never found a tub that worked with our first son until he was able to sit up on his own, but I don't think the PUJ existed at the time.)I think he likes it because of the way his bottom is held in place at the base and probably because it keeps enough water around him to keep him warm.  The foam material is not cold to the touch either with water in it.Seriously it is amazing how much more relaxed our son is in this tub vs the other tubs.Note that the first thing you'll think when you open the package is: I REALLY paid this much for a thin piece of folding foam plastic!?!  But once you see how relaxed your kiddo is in it you'll quickly be OK with it.A couple notes on sink dimensions.  I see some people who aren't happy because it doesn't fit in their sink.  It fits perfectly in our double kitchen sink...  Here are the dimensions of the side of the sink we put the tub in:  14" x 15.5" width and length at the top and then 7.5" deep.Really the top dimensions are the most important since the tub mostly rests there.  You could put a folded towel under it if your sink is too deep.  I bet it would work fine +/- an inch or so of these dimensions.  And then the shallower the sink the smaller you'll want the length and width at the top to be.I do wish the manufacturer would have given a list of sink dimensions that worked well prior to buying, but since it fit we are happy!

title: Great tub!!
author: Clancy
comments: I don't have to much to say other than I LOVE this tub. It is easy to break down, clean and store. Super easy and my little girl likes it. I highly recommend!

title: Awesome Newborn Tub!
author: Jesikah G.
comments: As a first time mother, I don't have the luxury of experience to guide me in my baby-related purchases. I added this to my baby registry because a) we needed an infant bathtub and b) because it looked pretty darn cool! I really wasn't expecting to love the Puj Tub as much as I do. I will list all of the features I love about the Puj Tub but don't go looking for the list of "cons" as, for me, there are none.EASY TO USE: It wasn't particularly clear to me, based on the photos available when I placed this on my registry, how the Puj Tub folded up from flat piece of foam to 3 dimensional tub but when I pulled it out of the box, it became very clear. There's 4 plastic-covered magnets down at the bottom that hold the folded foam together, creating the tub. Easy-peasy!SPACE SAVING: The fact that this tub flattens out is an awesome feature. The drainage holes offer built-in holes from which the tub can be hung on a hook, if desired. For some time, we used this tub in our pedestal sink in our downstairs half bathroom and chose to tuck it behind the sink. It doesn't completely "disappear", but it certainly isn't an eye sore either.COMFORTABLE: The foam that the Puj Tub is made out of is dense enough to provide structure yet soft enough to create a comfortable cradle for baby to enjoy tubby time. I never once felt that my daughter was uncomfortable in the Puj Tub.STYLISH: The white color and curved lines make for a stylish infant tub...much more attractive than the typical molded plastic infant tubs.LONG LASTING: For our daughter, this tub has continued to "fit" her well into her fifth month of life. Granted, she was born prematurely at a petite 5lbs and 17" in length, but she quickly "caught up" and is now, at 5 months, 16lbs 10oz and 27" in length. We alternate using the Puj Tub in the pedestal sink in the half bath and the vanity in the master bath. The variation in the depth and shape of the sinks causes variation in the pitch of the recline of the tub. In the more laid-back position created by the master bath vanity, the back of her head is just now approaching the top of headrest area. Actually, if a headrest extension were available (maybe it is...I dunno), we would be able to continue to use the Puj Tub until she is able to sit self-supported in the sink itself. This is definitely an item that will go into storage for future children.EASY TO CLEAN: We use a castile-based soap that tends to leave a fair amount of soap scum on the foam of the tub. We clean the Puj Tub about once per week with a few squirts of scrubbing bubbles. The scum comes right off and the cleaner rinses away completely, leaving the sparkling white tub we pulled out of the package.I'm sure there are more things I like about the Puj Tub but, at nearly 2am, they are escaping my mind. LOL I would definitely recommend this tub to everyone with an infant that doesn't sit upright on her own yet, not just those living in small spaces.

title: Rest assured
author: Emily Robbins
comments: After reading tons of reviews while filling out my baby registry, I vowed that I would review the products I settled on after I had used them for a little while because it was so helpful to hear what parents had to say. I had always been worried about where we would store a baby tub since we live in such a small place, and I was afraid of bathing my little baby in a big plastic infant tub because it just seemed like he would slide around too much. I was so thankful when I learned about the Puj tub and I am so glad that I registered for it. I have peace of mind when we bathe him. For the first few weeks of his life we were able to use the Puj tub in the bathroom sink, but as he grew we had to bring the tub down to the kitchen sink. It works beautifully in both locations. He doesn't slide all around. It is really easy to snap into shape, and when we aren't using it, it hangs unobtrusively in our shower on a hook. This was a fabulous purchase!

title: Best baby bath tub ever!
author: Lauren
comments: We received this baby bath tub as a baby shower gift and could not be more pleased with it! It fits nicely in all of our bathroom sinks and our son absolutely loves it. Before his umbilical cord fell off, he just hated being given a sponge bath but he smiles and coos the whole time he's in the Puj. Our only regret is that it is only recommended up to 17 lbs. and our little one is already 14 lbs at 10 weeks old, so it certainly won't last us the six months we'd hoped it would! Still, we plan to use it for future children and would definitely recommend it for other parents. We especially love that it can be stored flat, that it dries quickly, and that there are three holes to drain the water; the one in the center has turned out to be handy because our little guy regularly poops in the tub and it just slides through the hole and down the drain without leaving a trace!

title: Our sinks are too big or too deep
author: Kindle Customer
comments: I was so excited about this tub, so I was extremely disappointed to find that it didn't fit at all in our sinks.  Our bathroom sink is too wide (20" wide rectangle) and our kitchen sink is too deep.

title: You need to have an exact fit sink...also seems unstable
author: korish
comments: I bought this with the idea of bathing my newborn in the sink rather than bending over the tub.  It seemed pretty simple and had good reviews at the time.  When my daughter was born we did the sponge bath thing for a couple weeks then decided to put her in the Puj.  I was disappointed and my daughter was a little freaked out.  We have 4 sinks to choose from (including the kitchen) and not one of them was the right size for this tub to fit in.  I decided to stick it into a smaller sink than a larger one and after I folded it, stuck it in there and then stuck my daughter in...one of the sides kept popping undone which would make her startle.  Even when both sides were attached it still seemed rickety and unstable.  I could tell my baby never felt at ease in it.  I would keep a hand on her at all times but she would constantly flail her arms and legs.  I ditched this idea and moved on.

title: A True Must Have for Squirmy Newborn Bathing
author: ShoStev
comments: This thing is a god-send. I received this quirky looking infant bath as a shower gift and have been recommending it to friends and family since my little guy was two weeks old! It's perfectly soft and comfy for fragile newborn heads, fits perfect in every randomly shaped sink I have in this old house, and has been the major reason bathtime is my favorite time of day.The magnetic design and super lightweight material makes clean up and storage an absolute snap--extremely important when you're first learning how to do everything one-handed. I use it primarily in my kitchen sink and am greatful not to have to bend over an infant tub placed in the big, adult bath, and save my knees from the hard tile bath floor.Seriously. I can't say enough. Buy it for some new mommy you love. My only complaint is that now that little guy is approaching 15 lbs, I realize I'm going to have to move on. Believe I'll be passing this on (even with over-use, this tub will last and last!) to a preggo girlfriend!

title: cool but not worth $
author: Mrs.Bruin24
comments: We got the puj because we live in a small apartment and I didn't want one of those bulky baths. I think we've used it 4 times, it didn't fit in my bathroom sink, well it did but the faucet was kinda in the way and I was afraid the water temp could change and burn him or it could be too cold. So we tried it in the kitchen sink and that worked a little better because I could turn the faucet to the other side when regulating the temp. but my son did get cold and like someone else said the baby just gets a sponge bath plus my son is 2.5 months and has outgrown it. Anyway he much prefers to take baths with me and splash around.

title: Don't buy this tub!
author: Marnie F. Biando
comments: I agree with the other reviewer who mentioned it must be a sink size thing.  We moved from an apartment to a house when our infant was five weeks old, and between the apartment and the house, we never found a sink that the puj tub worked in.  I compared notes with other moms and found that they had the same problem: we all ended up using the Puj tab unfolded (flat) until eventually we each broke down and bought another tub.The tub does not stay folded in the tub shape!  I feel totally cheated on this baby registry item.  Good thing it was a gift.

title: Gimmicky!
author: cocolove
comments: The Puj Tub is so impractical! The baby gets VERY COLD because they're not immersed in the water. I only used this (as a tub) once. The person who recommended this tub to me as a "must have" had a baby born in May in NYC so I can see how it was perfect given weather and temperature conditions for her newborn. My baby was born at the end of September in Zurich, Switzerland, so it's not a good tub for us.I still use the Puj Tub, though! At the hospital, I was taught how to hold the baby steady and bathe her in about 6-8 inches of water in a kitchen type sink. I use our kitchen sink, but we have granite countertops, so the first bath in the kitchen I had to have my husband there holding the towel and it was awkward and our daughter cried a bit. Not only that, I was very afraid we would drop her!! Well, then I realized that the Puj is a firm foam. I now put the Puj Tub on the counter next to the sink with the hooded towel on top so that my baby goes straight from the water to towel in less than one second. It's working out great! A changing pad would be better because it has slight sides whereas the Puj Tub does not, but at least I didn't completely waste my money, right?My recommendation: Skip the Pub Tub.Instead buy: aden + anais Towel with Muslin Washcloth - Aqua Fish AND Dolphin Shaped Bath Thermometer, Color: AssortedI love the Aden + Anais muslin washcloth. It's soft enough to use on your baby's face. I also didn't think a bath thermometer was necessary and now I've gone out and bought one. It's really nice to know that the water will be just right for your baby going off of more than just touch.

title: Great in theory, not so great in actuality.
author: GGB
comments: Even though this tub is twice the price of other bathtubs, I couldn't resist the idea of a tub that is stored flat. Unfortunately, I'm now looking to buy one of the bulky infant bathtubs I was hoping to avoid since this tub doesn't work for us anymore, so I wish we'd just saved the money.PROS:-- The seat is soft and cushy and seems comfortable for our daughter.-- It goes flat and is so easy to store. We have a little suction cup hook that works perfectly to hang the Puj tub in the shower when it's not in use.-- Easy to clean.CONS:-- The magnets don't hold the seat together once the baby is placed in the tub. Before our baby was born I thought it would fit in any of our sinks, but once we put an actual wiggly baby into the tub I found that the magnets didn't hold.  So, I've only been able to make the tub work in one of our three sinks which happens to be about the right size to wedge the edges of the tub into the sink so that it stays at least semi-assembled.-- Because it only fits in our smallest sink, our baby never gets much more than a glorified sponge bath, which is great for water conservation but not nearly as much fun for our baby. (I've given her baths in a big sink with another person to help support her since the Puj tub wouldn't stay assembled, and the baby loved kicking and splashing.)-- Our daughter only really fit in it up until about 12-14 pounds. That means we spent $40 on a tub that was only useful for a few months, and since our baby can't sit up on her own yet we can't transition into the full-sized bathtub. Since we need another tub and I'm going to be stuck storing an infant tub anyway, I wish I hadn't bothered with this.

title: Definitely not worth it
author: Julie F.
comments: You have to have the *perfect* sink to hold this thing together. Our bathroom sink would be perfect, but the sharp faucet is within inches of the baby. We used it in our "prep" sink in our kitchen, with a few pieces of Tupperware wedged underneath it to keep it's shape.This is such a fantastic idea, but unfortunately it doesn't work with anything but the perfect sink; and it's SO expensive!I would recommend that you go to Once Upon a Child and get a rigid infant tub (I got mine for $6.50) to use on our counter during the first weeks.

title: Flimsy
author: Sunny Austin
comments: A folding infant bather seems like a great idea but this product doesn't cut it.  The magnets that are supposed to hold this together simply don't have enough strength, even in a small sink.  We attempted to use this item for baby's first bath but it was too flimsy. It did fold and store quite easily (past tense as we threw it away)but no way would I put a baby in this thing.

title: Nice Idea, but didn't work for us
author: seth
comments: This tub requires a very specific sink, one that is wide enough and not too deep, with a faucet that isn't too low. We tried using it in the tub like some reviews said, but the tub just wasn't stiff enough to hold its shape.

title: Great Tub for us minimalist.
author: Shelly Reinke
comments: I really like this tub.  I do not like to be surrounded with all kinds of huge plastic baby items that take up your whole house.  This tub does not take up hardly any space.  Just hang it on a hook on the back of your shower, it hangs flat.  I also like that you can use this tub in the bathroom or kitchen sink, no more bending over the bathroom tub.  The tub is soft and holds baby comfortably.  The other great thing is this tub will fit in your suitcase when you are traveling.  I also love the modern look to this tub!

title: A newborn's worst nightmare
author: Lukken Love
comments: The material is like styrofoam and squeaks horribly. Tub can only be used in a sink that is small or the magnetic closures will come apart. It sits right under the faucet which makes it difficult to protect baby from water temperatures.  Water only fills up to the waist before it starts draining out the drain holes and there isn't enough space to dunk a washcloth down into the water so you have to keep the water running or your baby will get cold. I was hoping to save space but ended up with a product that didn't work for us at all. My baby cried every time we attempted to use this tub. He seemed chilly because the top part of his body wasn't submerged in water and he was overwhelmed by the running water coming down on him and then the thing would come apart and I would have to scramble for the towel to lift him out all the while loud squeaks that make your skin crawl in the background. Kind of a newborns worst nightmare. We decided to just bath with our baby to help him feel secure in water and bond with him in his early months or just give him a quick wash cloth rinse if needed. Baby bathtubs are for the birds but I don't think this one could even entice a bird...

title: Not Deep Enough to be Useful
author: SarahD
comments: This sounded like a good idea, and I had no problems fitting this in my square kitchen sink by placing a large round bowl in the bottom of the sink to hold it, but I found that this tub would hold so little water that only the very bottom of my baby's butt would get wet. The water wasn't even deep enough to submerge his whole crotch area for proper cleaning--and that was when he was like 6-7 lbs. That made this tub not much better at cleaning than a sponge bath but much more awkward than just laying the baby on a towel on the counter to do a sponge bath. I ended up using it only a few times. On the plus side, it would be very hard for a baby to drown in the amount of water this thing would hold.

title: Yet to find a sink that it fits in besides at home
author: BluViolet
comments: I bought this for travel and have yet to find a hotel sink that fits it.  Plus, it will not stay together in a tub.  It goes together with magnets....so no sink no support.  When it fits in a sink it is great.  My home sinks work....but they are large.  My kitchen sink is too large.  Since that didn't work for me I bought one of those rounded covered sponge supports.....works great in all size tubs and sinks.

title: I thought this would be perfect, but....
author: TrueBlue
comments: I thought this would be perfect, but my little one was born 9 1/2 lbs, he was simply too big. This would have served it's purpose for a weeks, but that's all. This product would better people whose sinks have tall faucet spigots.

title: Present for baby shower
author: orianita
comments: The new mom was super happy when she received my gift, but I cannot review the product myself as it was a present for a babyshower.

title: Suitable for smaller babies and double sink bathrooms
author: L. Lino
comments: I used this tub when my baby was first born but she was a big baby and now she is 4 months old she is too tall for it.  Also, if you only have a single sink its very tricky.  You run the water into the tub first and of course that makes the faucet hot. The faucet actually dips inside the tub so it only takes a single movement and the baby could burn herself.  I stopped using it because of this. I am amazed more reviewers do not mention this safety aspect.Also with a single sink how can you get more water to pour over the baby?

title: Great tub
author: Crystal Elizabeth Alling
comments: Great tub for using with an infant.  We have to use it in our master bathroom as the sink in our spare bathroom isn't big enough for us to use.  I will say that it seems a bit hard to get her out of the tub when we're done, but maybe that's just the way it is.  Don't know how long we will be able to use it, she seems to be getting big fast and the tub looks smaller every time we use it!  The ability to hang it up to dry is great.  I would recommend using it in a sink with a high arching faucet so you don't worry so much about hitting the babies head as you take them in and out of it.  It also doesn't hold a ton of water, which is great for newborns, but the water becomes cold relatively quickly and there's not a ton of water in it which leaves you with little to work with once you get them in there.

title: Easy to store, easy to use
author: Eric E
comments: This was a great tub for our daughter's first 6 months.  It felt safer to have her in the sink.  Probably the best thing is how easy it is to store.  We hung it in the closet with velcro computer cord ties.4 stars instead of 5 because the magnets unstuck during baths a fair amount, especially when baby got more wiggly.

title: Good Concept, but not so great for bigger babies.
author: Avid Shoppers
comments: When I put this item on my registry, I thought it was great without really thinking it through. My baby was born almost 10 lbs, and barely fit in this tiny tub to begin with. We were only able to use this tub for about 3-4 months, and for the price, you could get much more use out of another tub. The concept is great, but in the end, I was dissatisfied with the fact that there was never enough water to keep the baby warm during the bath, the water always drained out. We just ended up getting a fisher price newborn to toddler tub, and have used that ever since (baby is 13 months).Better tub for premies, or smaller babies.

title: Puj soft foldable baby bath tub
author: marylee
comments: Purchasing the Puj  soft foldable baby bath tub wasone of the best gift tomy daughter-in-law twins.She simply love it easy to use and set up.  She said she feels confident that the babies won't slip around.The twins love taking their bath!

title: Good concept but doesn't work as well as I'd like
author: Mj
comments: Great concept, but the tub is doesn't hold the baby's weight well enough to stay propped on top of the sink. My baby is only 8lbs and change and the tub drops down as soon as you put him in and the water drains out. I like the idea and will continue to use it for a couple more weeks. In the meantime I'm looking for a different tub. This definitely won't work if my son gains another couple of pounds.

title: Makes Bathtime Delightful!
author: kenz515
comments: We received this tub as a gift and I was thrilled at the small size and space saving aspects of it.  Although our son grew out of it quickly (he was a very large baby) we used this happily for the first month and were sad when we had to transition into a bigger tub.  It worked perfectly in my granite sinks and I felt very secure with the baby in the tub. Our son loves bath time and I believe that is because of this tub!

title: Good for 0-4 months
author: Sam Lowry
comments: Excellent for what it is, highly portable and compact, fits most sinks, and is good for babies up to 4 months.  We have used it since we brought our girl home from the hospital and love it.  So, Pros: highly portable, easily stored, fits most sinks, compact, easy to use, fast drying, saved my back.  Cons: agree with other posters that it won't work in your kitchen sink - the magnets are not strong enough and the back will unfold.  The design of it demands it be used in a sink.  Also, our sink has lever faucets and I have to be careful she doesn't kick the cold water faucet while bathing otherwise the water will turn hot very quickly and it could scald her leg - no room to accommodate sudden changes in water temperature due to size.  I'm 6' 2" tall and it literally saved my back!  At 4 months though it's time to move on.  Great for what it is, great for traveling with an infant, but limited to 0 - 3 months and cannot be used in the kitchen sink without some kind of trickery.

title: One of my top three newborn must-haves!
author: BFCDMom
comments: We used the Puj Tub with our daughter as first-time parents and LOVED it! We used it on one side of our double kitchen sink and she fit perfectly inside it (6 lbs, 8 oz when she came home, maybe 7.5 lbs at the time of her first bath?). I really like several features of this tub:1. Never had concern for baby's safety -- the soft foam that makes up this tub seems very comfortable for the baby to sit in.2. Genius design -- when I purchased the tub, I couldn't tell how it worked from the photo.  It is a large single piece which folds inward on each side. Once it is folded (it actually snaps into place), it is held in place by magnets (I believe). This creates the contoured bowl-type shape that baby sits in. There is enough "depth" to it that baby will actually sit in the water, yet the spaces in the sides of the folded tub don't allow for the water to get too high. Also, the edges are very soft and I noticed that she never had any red marks on her skin when she would move her legs across an edge.3. Dries quickly -- We would hang the tub to dry after her bath. Very thin and easy to hang behind a door -- a space-saving must-have if you are in an apartment or smaller home.All in all, a great purchase, and something I would highly recommend to new parents. We used it with our daughter until she was three months old and approximately 13.5-14 lbs and no longer fit well in it (last time we used it, she weighed it down noticeably and as a result, the tub would "lean" to one side).

title: Save your money
author: Holly
comments: I bought this after seeing it featured in a parenting magazine. I truly wish I hadn't spent the money on it - a complete waste of money. It's claim that it works in any sink isn't true. It's too big for my bathroom sink which is standard sized - once you put the tub in the sink and then the child in the tub, there isn't any room for any water. So, I then tried it in my kitchen sink, but it won't stay together - the magnets aren't strong enough to keep it together in the intended shape. So, my alternative is to put some large washcloths in the bottom of the bathroom sink and then putting my child on the washcloths for some padding. It's a low cost alternative that works so much better than this Puj tub. Please don't waste your money!

title: Not worth the money...
author: Kristin
comments: I don't think the puj tub is worth the money at all. The only nice thing about it is that it dries quickly. My son moves a little when I'm giving him a bath (he's only 1 month old and have been using it since birth) and the thing comes undone. It fits okay in our bathroom and kitchen sink but not the greatest. I personally think that the $10 tub I got for my daughter at walmart works 100x better. Not going to recommend to anyone I know.

title: Don't buy PUJ Tub here for shower gift.
author: Christina Jones
comments: I bought the PUJ Tub from Amazon, they got it to me very quickly, but the outside of the product box was not protected. It had all of the shipping info stuck to the outside, the top was ripped open and torn to shreds, as well it was dented on the corners. The PUJ Tub was on my friend's Baby Shower list. I'm sure this tub will be just what the little momma will want, but it sure doesn't look very pretty for the same money I could have just spent elseware.

title: Would not buy again
author: MomX2
comments: Purchased this because it was recommended by a friend.  Tried to use with my newborn and it appears my bathroom sink is too small and my kitchen sink is too large.  When I tried to put the baby in the tub in the kitchen sink, the tub came undone and flattened.  I had no way of knowing the tub did not fit in my sink properly until I went to set down my baby.  The tub appeared to fit properly.  I would use with caution.

title: Good in theory
author: SBentley
comments: I love the idea of this tub.  Not having to bend over the regular bathtub (like I did with my older son) is great, but this tub only fits in our sink if we fold up one side.  That's not really a problem because it gives him more room (it's a tiny tub and I have a small baby-5 lbs at birth, 12 lbs at 4 months), but the holes, which I assume are to allow water out for safety reasons are way too low and the minute I put him in the tub, all the water is gone, except for a small puddle beneath him.  Since the tub was so expensive, I'm determined to use it and have found that if I use the baby washcloths (thank goodness they come many to a pack) to plug up the drain holes, it holds just enough to bathe him.  I do keep a jug of warm water on the sink though to rinse him with.  We have really high goose neck faucets, so it's fine for us, but I can't imagine this is really safe if you have the standard low faucets.  Don't spend $40 on this tub.  Buy a less expensive one and just set it on the counter.

title: Love It
author: L. owens
comments: I just got the Puj Tub yesterday and today was my baby's first "real bath" by herself.  She has taken one with my oldest daughter and we have given her sponge baths but mostly we take her in the shower. Which requires one person to hand her in, one person to do the showering and the other to get her out again.  She is my sixth baby so I have tried and gotten rid of every type of tup there is pretty much. Big plastic, small sling, I have not tried the Pod tub but after seeing one, just didn't love it.  What I dislike so much about the big plastic ones is that they are.....well, big and plastic. I don't have anywhere that I can easily store that big thing. So, I have gotten one with each baby and then given it away when they outgrew it. I never like the sling ones, although I have purchased 3 or 4 to remind myself why I don't like them. So, I did some research and found the Puj. I did they  two day shipping and got it yesterday, so day was moment of truth time...........I LOVE IT!PRO'SIt is not big and plasticIt fit's in my sink, I am uploading pictures because I have a vessel sink and was a little concernedWater is continuously draining at a nice pace but leaves enough water to bathe baby and keep baby warmWhen you are done, rinse and hang to dryCon'sSo far the only con is that I didn't get it three months ago.  My baby was a preemie and a little on the small side for three months but I don't know how long she will fit in this sink.I will update if there are any changes but so far, I am so happy with my purchase!

title: The best back saving invention
author: X. Nguyen
comments: My son has been using this since he was born.  He is now 18 pounds and still uses it. He lovesssss it and can sit in it all day.  I've used it in a variety of different sized sinks.  It takes a little bit of getting used to, but it's workable, depending on how you fold the tub.  Now that he's bigger and heavier some of the deeper sinks are not compatible with it.  It is pricey for just a piece of Styrofoam though.  We have owned it for 5 months so far and the material has held up fine.  Although I agree if your child is heavier I don't know how much longer this product would be useful, but so far we love it.  Good space saver and great to take on travel too.

title: Great when used with the Prince Lionheart FlexiBath!
author: Rachel Stegman
comments: The main complaint I have with this tub is that you have to have a sink with a specific dimension/shape.  It didn't work with any of the sinks at both my place and my parents' place.  So it didn't get used for the recommended newborn to 17 pounds timeframe. I used and LOVED the WashPod instead.Now here is the twist in the story!  I used the Prince Lionheart WashPod for my baby's first 6 months (LOVED IT BTW)!  Then I got the Prince Lionheart FlexiBath for my baby for 6 months on.  This company claims that the FlexiBath can be used for newborns. However, it is really difficult to use for babies who are under 1 year old because even if they can sit unassisted outside the tub, they cannot sit at all in the tub when there is water in it. So I would recommend it only for babies closer to a year old UNLESS you use the FlexiBath tub with the Puj Tub!!!  Now the Puj Tub has a new life (after the recommended 6/7 month use period)!  It fits fantastically in the FlexiBath. I called both companies to tell them about my find, and I think they should cross-promote.So, if you are like me and like "alternative-style" bathing for your babe--different from the usual "American laying-back-style" tubs--then my recommendation is the WashPod and/or the Puj Tub (if you have the right shape/size sink) for baby's first 6 months. Then use the Puj Tub WITH the FlexiBath from 6 months to 1 year. Then the FlexiBath solo from 1+ years.Also, I like to bring the WashPod and the FlexiBath-Puj Tub combo into the shower with me...I find it keeps him warmer and we both get clean together!

title: came apart before I could use it - twice
author: Trevor Pietsch
comments: I love the idea, but wish I could have used it. I registered for and received one as a baby shower gift, and as I snapped it together to demonstrate for dear grandma who didn't understand, the whole snap thing came out of the main piece making it impossible to use. I returned it (thanks to Amazon's awesome return/exchange policy) for another one and the second one did the exact same thing! I gave up and am using the good old blue, whale-shaped hand-me-down baby bath tub instead. Like I said, I love the idea and wish I could have used it, but I think it could be made better.

title: Great tub; a little pricey.
author: A. Krause
comments: I got this tub used on e-bay for about $30. It is very supportive and my daughter seems comfortable in it. It makes bathing her in the sink pretty quick and easy. I do wish it held a little more water. She is now 2 1/2 months old, just under 10 lbs, and the water really only covers her little bottom and part of her back. I do like that it keeps her head comfortably above water. But I would like to immerse her legs and belly a bit more.I have tried 3 different methods of rinsing with this tub:1. I get the water to the right temperature at a low pressure and let it run during her bath, leaving the drain open under the tub. That way I don't have to worry about turning the water on while she's under the faucet and dousing her with too cold or hot water. The downside to this is wasting water.2. I plug the drain once she's in the tub (if she's not in it it floats up) and turn the water off once the sink is full. Then I use a wash cloth to rinse her, bending up the corner of the tub to dip it into the water in the sink.3. I fill a pitcher with water before the bath (like they show in the video).All methods work pretty well, but I prefer the first two.I recommend the tub if you don't mind spending the money for something that is in use for only a few months. I think my DD will have outgrown it in another month or so.

title: Great back saver & baby loves it!
author: ASavery
comments: I love this tub - it hugs our baby tightly yet we can still wash her very easily. We use it in our kitchen sink - the puj is too small to go in the sink by itself since they are made for pedestal sinks, but we solved that problem by placing it in a large pot within the sink (not too deep so baby doesn't sit too high out of the sink) - also, a big salad bowl works as well. There are magnets that help hold it in shape and we discovered those magnets double as a storage holder - we flatten it and then stick it on the side of our fridge when we're done! There are holes to hang it as well, but I have to say the side of the fridge is pretty handy since its out of sight. Our baby is 6 months old, 95th percentile in height and 80th percentile in weight and still fits. She's almost ready to sit on her own and it will be perfect timing to transition her to the tub.

title: Fabulously simple and functional
author: Willis, TX ~ Mom
comments: First, this was a lifesaver!!  It is simple, easy to use, and very effective.  I found this by accident and purchased it based on the reviews.  I was ELATED to have it after the first use!  No back-breaking, stressing about my baby slipping away from me in the sink, tub, or anywhere else!  All the stuff about folding/flattening for space saving and ease of cleaning is all good and wonderful, but this was just so easy to use to bathe my baby, I can't fully describe how happy I was to know I could safely bathe her!!  She loves baths and I think part of it is because she has always felt so safe, and we have always just been able to focus on bathing, singing, and looking in the mirror at each other while bathing.I have read the other reviews about sinks not fitting, the "tub" unfolding, large babies, etc.  Here's what I can share:  I have used this tub in four different sinks, multiple times each.  My baby was 7 lbs 5 ozs 19.5" at birth, and at four months was 24+ inches and 14 lbs 5 oz ~ so she's avg to above avg height and weight.  I am still bathing her in this tub and she is now to a point where kicking, splashing and waving her arms in the bathtub is requisite and part of the fun ~ she does all of those things at her current size (she is now four months and three weeks).  I will probably have to move to her "other" baby bath tub in the next month if she hits a growth spurt, if not, she will make six months in this tub for sure).As for being close to the water and it suddenly changing temperatures.... well, if the baby is in the sink and the water suddenly changes temperatures, I'm pretty sure this is a risk of bathing in a sink..............just sayin'.  All sinks have this risk; it has nothing to do with this thin, bathing tub!As for the baby being close to the faucet, well, yes, again, if you are getting in a sink to bathe, chances are you are going to be close to the faucet.... this is a function of the overall shape of your sink [obviously].  My baby is at a point where she can sit up quite a bit and grab the faucet and pull on it, etc.  She is also interested in chewing on it.  All of those temptations and abilities, she is still bathing in it and she has not yet turned the water to scalding on herself ~ again, a risk of bathing in a sink!  If you have an uber "modern" sink that is more like a runoff than a sink, then bathing is going to be a challenge in such a sink.  (duh)As for the tub "falling apart..."  The tub has two sets of magnets that take it from "flat" to "tub."  YES, they can and do come apart while bathing (sink dependent).  HOWEVER, not in every sink, and it hasn't posed a problem for me when it did happen.  In my master bath sink, it does it every time, so, I actually don't set up both magnets anymore.  I fold the one side and not the other.  It is great.  My daughter's head is always out of the water and she just loves to wiggle and play while we bathe.I understand there may be some shallow sinks in the world.  However, dinging this product because you have a sink that is going to be difficult at best to bathe a baby in is not fair.  This product is simple in its design and very effective in its use.  This is an A+ product and is one of my personal "must haves" for all moms!  Enjoy!

title: great!! for small babies
author: Mameyes
comments: i absolutely loved this tub. . . the soft material, being able to hang it flat on the back of my bathroom door, the fact that the water continuously streams out of it, allowing fresh water in from the faucet, and ofcourse being able to bathe my baby in the sink.  HOWEVER, my lovely boy outgrew the tub by about 5 weeks... I continued to bathe him in it for a while, until I realized that i wasnt able to get into all the little crevices of his body b/c there was no room for him to stretch out... was it worth $40 for 3 weeks of use?  (We didnt bathe him for the first 2 weeks).  Maybe not.  But if you have a smaller baby, who stays small for a while, its a great product.

title: Not suitable for any baby larger than a newborn
author: Katrina W
comments: This tub does not work for my baby.  My baby is large and loves to kick.  No matter which sink I place the Puj in, my baby places his feet on the side of the Puj (where they're supposed to go) and then pushes off, launching him back onto the countertop since the Puj becomes slippery when wet.  The design seems flawed and unsafe to me.  I am giving it 2 stars instead of 1 because this may work well for a small newborn, but I wouldn't put anything over 8-9 pounds (or a kicker!) in it.

title: Gorgeous design, but...
author: Carey L. Corbin
comments: I love the design of this tub, and it was one of the first things I purchased for my baby. Unfortunately I used it for only the first 6 weeks (when you don't bathe the baby that much). I wanted to avoid getting a rigid tub because of its footprint (we have a small space with a smaller bathroom). Celia hated baths in this and I had to breakdown and get a rigid tub (which she loves).  Ours has a mesh hammock that gently dips the baby in the water. It is not stylish, however.

title: Fits ANY sink & Hangs FLAT to dry!
author: Shane Hartman
comments: I had my first child almost 9 months ago. I registered for very few items except for "necessities" like a breast pump, monitor, etc. I spent a lot of time researching bathing tubs. I was very nervous about bathing my newborn, since I was about to be a first-time mom. So a tub was important to me. This Puj Tub is AMAZING! It fits in every sink we have. With the way it's made, it's impossible for it not to fit in any sink. I saw a review today about how it doesn't fit in someone's sink and that doesn't make sense to me. That's actually what prompted me to write this review. It's pliable and gives you many different options as to how you can make it work for you. I started by bathing my daughter in our bathroom sink, which I think is unusally small. She's very tall and so a few months ago, we moved her to the kitchen sink, where I can use the tub on either side. I started on the smaller side of the kitchen sink, and as she grew taller, moved her to the other side. She's not quite sitting up on her own yet, so at nearly 9 months old, I'm still using this tub to give her support. I cannot recommend it enough. The second best thing about this tub (and the reason I bought it) is that it hangs flat on the back of my bathroom door. It's extremely light, so I just hang it on a small nail and it dries almost instantly. I'm amazed a tub like this wasn't developed sooner. It's sleek and is perfect for a mom who either doesn't want baby things in every room of the house, or for a mom who is tight on space. One last thing about this tub...my husband had never been around babies before ours and was very, very nervous to bathe her. He couldn't stop talking about how safe he felt bathing her because of this tub. I have never posted a review, but I found other people's reviews of this tub so helpful when I was doing my research, that I wanted to encourage others that you will LOVE this tub!

title: Perfect!
author: Laura Sweet
comments: Yes, this probably fits best in a round sink, which we have. The think I love about this is that my daughter now 4 months old fits snuggly in the tub. I don't have to hold her up at all. I can bathe her hands free to wash all her little limbs. She loves just chilling out in this bath. Sometimes I just turn off the water and let her relax in the tub. There is no risk of her drowning because she can't go anywhere ( of course I always watch her closely). It has become her ( and mine too) favorite part of her bedtime routine. Yes, she will outgrow this by six months. I will be sad when I have to transition her to the big tub and bend over to bathe her. This saves my back and is easy to travel with and store. Ohh.. And I wash it in the washing machine about once a week. So easy to clean that way.

title: outgrew it too fast
author: nekoBasu
comments: great concept.real space saver, which is important to me.my boy is now coming up on 5 weeks old, and he's outgrown it.some reviewers comment that their sinks are not compatible.  maybe that's my problem, maybe not.it worked nicely in our bathroom sink at 2 weeks, but as he's putting on a couple of pounds, the magnets don't seem to hold, and we constantly have to take him out of the puj to add water, (don't want to leave him in under the running faucet, could get burned), because it leaks.no real strong negative emotions, but for the money, had I known he would outgrow it so fast I probably would have gone with something else.

title: Baby Shower Gift
author: Gail R. Shapiro
comments: Item was purchased as a baby shower gift. The tub was on wish list of the mother-to-be. The mother-to-be was delighted.

title: soon to be mom excited to try it
author: Jessica Grimes
comments: haven't officially used it yet - but it is soft, light weight and fits well in our sink- a sink that is pretty standard and we wont have to modify.It does feel a bit more flimsy than I expected but besides that I have high hopes :D

title: New Mom's Rejoice!!
author: A. Gift For You
comments: LOVE LOVE LOVE this product.  Our baby is 2 weeks old and my husband and I are not baby people.  We love ours but have never really hung out or handled other people's babies - so we are complete newbies when it comes down to baby care.Anyway, after reading a bunch of tub reviews I thought I was ready and had purchased the Eco Spa Tub in addition to newborn toiletries.  We've been focusing on organics and Eco friendly products but who's kidding who - in the middle of the night when he floods his changing table and is covered in pee you need to react.  Our first bath was sheer panic.  My husband and I were trying to balance him in his Eco tub with one of us holding him and the other washing him.  It was SCARY.  We decided to sponge bath until he grows into it, but after a few days of that decided we needed to something else that would get him cleaner.I then found the Puj online and it just arrived yesterday.  We were going to try it out this weekend, but we had a diaper explosion last night around 3AM - we opened and set up the Puj in record time. It didn't fit in our small bathroom sink, but it did fit in the kitchen sink (side by side).  Once we set him in it a hush fell over the room.  He was supported so we were able to breath and the baby stopped screaming to look around.  This tub supports him, is small, easy to set up, and easy to store.  Honestly, I can't see this working when he's big, but it will work for at least the first 6 months....  Well worth it and we can still keep our Eco Spa for when he's older.

title: Not Worth the Money
author: Gretchen Yagielski
comments: I bought this tub on the recommendation of a friend who had heard good things about it. I didn't know it would only work in oval bathroom sinks (my bathroom sink is rectangular), so this tub barely fits- I had to prop it up with towels to keep the magnet end from coming apart and the faucet was in my son's face. It is also very small and hard to bathe my son in it. I replaced it with the First Years Infant/Toddler tub for less than half the price and it is so much better! The only positive thing that I can say about this tub is that I like that it lays flat for easy storage, but it's too bad it didn't work for us.

title: Best invention EVER
author: J. Gore
comments: This is the handiest piece of baby equipment I've received since I found out I was pregnant. I haven't tried it out yet but I'm more excited about using this than anything else I've got. The tub snaps together using magnets that are surprisingly strong and it fits in my standard sink perfectly. I was somewhat concerned that it might not fit under small, un-arched faucets when I bought it but it works perfectly under mine. Great product.

title: fairly disappointing
author: Desi D.
comments: I was so excited to get this item for my baby (currently 34 weeks pregnant).  My best friend brought her baby for my baby shower and I asked her try out some of my items I had rcvd, the Puj Tub being one of them.  We were both so impressed with the compatibility of the tub with my small sink in the nursery.  After we put her 3 month old daughter who weighs about 12 lbs. into the tub the excitement quickly dissolved. The tub would not stay together! I kept trying to hold the magnets together.  Luckily, I'd already rcvd the Fisher Price tub w/ sling and that saved the day.  I've read another reviewer complain about the 'weak magnets' and I feel that maybe that's happened with us.  I really wanted this to work bc I wanted the convenience of a sink tub than having to bend down into an adult size tub.  I probably won't be requesting another one of these and instead hit the drawing board for another solution for my sink.

title: Must Have for Newborn Bathtime
author: jsb
comments: I'm a first time parent and bathing my baby after her umbilical stump fell off was a bit nerve wracking. This was the perfect thing to use the first several months of my daughter's life. It fully supports and cradles her so you're not holding her with one hand and trying to wash with the other. Plus it's super soft but does not soak (like a sponge) so dries very quickly. We hang it on the wall next to our bathroom sink so it takes up no space whatsoever. I should also note that my daughter never did that falling reflex thing when in the Puj Tub.The only thing I had to watch out for was overfilling the PujTub because when the baby would go in, the water would pour out and sometimes overfill or pour into those holes in your sink and get water in the cabinet underneath the sink. I had a bowl with warm clean water set aside to rinse my baby off after the bath and also to resoak the washcloth. Now that she's over 15lbs. (which is the PujTub limit) we use the Primo Eurobath which we love as well.

title: Twins LOVED bath time!
author: Sarah
comments: My twins never love the same things but the Puj Tub put that to rest.  At a month old we were still fighting bath time fears because we had trouble keeping both babies warm and comfortable during their baths.  I was skeptical that this would be comfortable for my smallest baby (at 5lbs, 13 oz) but she snuggled into the warm water like a pro!I wouldn't say that this is easy to put together with one hand but that may be because the foam is still a little stiff and just needs to be used a couple of times.  The tub fit into my standard sink with standard low-profile faucet with ease but I would have trouble adding water with the baby in the tub.  I ended up using a cup and an extra tub with water that I poured over my little ones instead of trying to fidget with the faucet.The foam stayed nice and warm and the babies were comfortable, it was a little difficult to get to their backsides but it's definitely doable.I love that I didn't have to bend over, didn't have to kneel and didn't have to trek to the kitchen sink.  The tub is a little pricey but it was worth having a calming bath experience!  Overall this was a great purchase and I am very happy!

title: Fits any standard sink?  Not so much.
author: B. Copp
comments: This, for us, was an absolute waste of money.  We have two bathroom sinks and this doesn't work in either.  Great idea, but apparently we just have completely non-standard sinks in our otherwise completely standard apartment.  This is only good if the water coming out of the faucet is the perfect temperature to neither scald nor freeze your baby.  The faucet ends up all in the baby's grill.  Alternatively (in our other sink) the tub can't handle the depth: once the baby goes in, the whole thing collapses.  The only thing this thing is good for is a really ugly white wall decoration.

title: Ok if you get one with strong magnets!
author: Superflyemily
comments: Our little guy is...not so little (9.5 lbs at birth), so maybe that was part of our issue with this tub. While I love the idea that the Puj tub is flat/portable, dries fast and looks cool, the magnets on this thing were a big issue for us. They were not able to contain our baby past maybe 15 lbs. Really, it would take two of us -- one to hold the magnets together and the other to bathe the baby -- to get it to work, which actually made bath time harder. I'm not sure if this is due to the shape of our sink (square) or not, but it became pretty annoying. I feel like, for the price, you should be getting some industrial-strength magnets. Also, we our sink has two taps, and like other reviewers have said, the tub gets so close to the spout that we were constantly worried he was going to bang his head (even with a spout cover). If your sink is just the right size/shape, you have a smallish baby and not a lot of space in your home, then go for it.

title: Great concept but...
author: buzzy
comments: I love the product concept - beautiful modern design, folds flat and portable, fits in the sink. However, I only used it for about 6-7 weeks (started using it when baby was about 2 weeks old).  It fit into my small oval bathroom sink but, as another mother pointed out, the faucet is dangerously close to baby and too awkward to get her in and out. Also, it was difficult to lean baby forward to wash her back or lift her to wash her bottom because of the proximity of the faucet and the angle of the fold. I didn't have the issue with the magnet giving way and unfolding the tub, because i think that could have been due to the size of the sink (maybe too large for the puj?).I tried to see if it would fit my kitchen sink instead, but it wouldn't.I received this as a baby shower gift. I think it's too expensive to purchase and the product leaves a lot to be desired.If the manufacturer could address the sink size issue (flexibility to fit larger kitchen sinks where faucets are not too close), then it probably would solve the other issues with getting the baby in and out, leaning and lifting the baby, or having the puj unfold when the magnets give way). just my two cents...

title: Watse of money!
author: Amanda
comments: I read several hundred reviews about this tub it seems. I was excited to try it out because we have a small bathroom and the space-saving idea seemed great. That is about the only thing that is great about this tub. I liked the idea of the comfort it would provide for the baby. That seems to only work if the baby is perfectly still. It takes two of us to bathe her just to make sure the tub or her doesn't move the handles. The first time I tried bathing her on my own, she almost got burned. She wiggles so much that the tub comes completely undone. Not only that it does not fit in the sink at all. It might fit in the kitchen sink except it seems to need an oval or circular sink to work properly. Also, she is already outgrowing the tub. Not by weight, but by height. She is not even 3 months old. I am regretting this purchase and now I have to go and find another tub that will work better.

title: best baby tub ever!
author: segkd
comments: i'll start by saying i'm a mom of five kids, all under the age of seven.  this ain't my first rodeo!  after the first two kids, we gave up on baby tubs because they were more hassle than they were worth.  they were big and difficult to store, hard to keep clean, and didn't fit baby well or for very long.  we resorted to either bathing with baby (which isn't always convenient) or using one of those yellow foam pads in the regular tub (but those always get gross).  in one fell swoop, the puj tub solved all of our problems!our baby was born weighing just under ten pounds, so size wasn't an issue, but his floppy newborn body was a bit of an awkward fit at first.  we didn't like the puj in our bathroom sink, but discovered it fit our kitchen sink perfectly.  our kitchen sink is one of the ones that has a large, deep sink on one side and then a smaller, shallower sink on the other.  it fit the smaller sink PERFECTLY.  the jackpot was when we realized that the puj was practically made to be placed inside of an upside-down ikea letten stool (which we keep in the bathroom for the kids or for me to use when pregnant).  this allows baby to hang out in the shower or tub with us, in his own little tub.we store the puj on a suction hook in the shower, so it's completely out of the way.  it wipes down clean and doesn't get moldy like those foam pads.  we can use it like he foam pads, though, by just laying it on the floor of the shower or tub.  baby is now six months old and weighs 20 pounds and he still fits in the puj just fine.hands down, best baby tub ever.  it seems like a lot of money for a piece of foam, but it works so well that it's worth every penny!

title: I love it!!!
author: Mom2three
comments: This tub is great! I used it from two weeks until 4 months when my baby reached 16 lbs. At that point he was too big! My baby never cried in this tub! It kept him nice and warm. It fit in my bathroom sink with no problems. I think the very best feature is that it folds flat for storage. You can hang it on the back of the door to dry and until you need to use it again. Doesn't take up space  at all!! It's just a piece of foam but it works so well! Wish I would have thought of this. I'm very pleased!

title: LOVE IT! NO tears during first bath!
author: ellecee82
comments: Put our daughter in this for her first bath and she didn't shed a tear! Awesome product! The foam is soft and keeps baby warm. I would recommend this to anyone!

title: Great space saver tub
author: jamie
comments: Definitely like the Puj tub. This is my second baby and with the first one, we had the typical newborn to toddler tub that could fit in the sink. The thing I didn't like about that tub was that it was bulky, hard to clean, and water was everywhere!With the puj tub, I am able to store it flat against the shower wall.It fits nicely in my sink with perfect sized holes in the sides to let water escape.The perfect fit in the tub saves my back from excess strain.I can set up the tub easily without worrying about the hassle of cleaning it constantly (since it hangs in our shower, the water from our shower cleans the tub whenever I shower. (Not to mention it is white so you can see if there are any poop stains on the tub).Things I do not like:Definitely is only good for probably the first couple months. My little girl was born at 6 lbs and 14 ounces and at 6 weeks old she still has a good amount of room (she is 10 lbs now). I will have to use my old toddler tub probably after the 4th or 5th month.The magnets on one side of the tub came unglued and I had to fix it. It wasn't that big a deal, but you would think that at 40 bucks it wouldn't need fixing.I have a small tupperware of warm water and soap next to me to bath her with since the tub only holds enough to soak just her lower half. She is content with having her lower half on the water and likes the puj tub.If your baby poops in the puj tub, it sucks because you have to lift her out to get the poopy water out and refill it with fresh water...though I guess you would do that with any toddler/newborn tub : ) Though since you can actually do all this with one hand, it is a perk with the puj tub and not a disadvantage.

title: Poor Customer Service!
author: lovethissite
comments: Puj Tub arrived broken due to a manufacturing defect!! The company would not stand behind their product because it was bought on the internet!! WARNING!

title: Innovative and neat, but expected better quality.
author: J.Lopez
comments: I read reviews on this tub and was very excited to try it when my baby was born.  I ended up getting it as a gift and totally loved it at first.  Here's what I loved:* Stores flat* Fits in the bathroom sink* It's made of foam,so it's soft* Looks cooler than those other plastic baby tubs* Keeps baby at an angle* Magnets keep the tub folded together.  It won't accidentally pop open on its own.* Drain hole allows water to release, no need to worry about water level getting too high for baby* Because it's made of foam, you don't have to worry about placing your baby on a cold surface.My baby is 3 months old now and we've hardly used it because we found that it was just easier for us (and warmer for her) to take her into the regular bathtub with us.  That is more of a personal preference thing.  Some parents may not feel comfortable enough to do that.  So now that I've had time to use the puj tub (even if it wasn't that much), here's what I'm not crazy about:* The Price* Quality of the foam: For $40, I would've expected better quality.  We've used the tub only about 5 times and it's scratched up and can easily get indentations in it if you're not careful about what you put on top of it or lean against it.  I guess I was expecting material more like a thick yoga mat or something.  Old Navy Flip Flops have better quality than this.I'm glad that I got it as a gift and didn't pay for it because I'd probably be a little more unhappy about it.  I'm just glad that it stores flat so at least it's not taking up that much space.  I can't say that you could probably use it over and over through the years because I don't think the foam will last that long.  Maybe through a second child.  Maybe.  This tub is okay, but I wouldn't buy another and I wouldn't recommend it to a friend, unless they were cramped for space and had a bigger baby budget.

title: Takes two
author: xochitl09
comments: We have a pedestal sink with a high arc, two handle faucet and the Puj does not work well in it.  The sink is too small for the Puj even though it is an average size pedestal sink.  The Puj is ok, but it takes two us to bath our little guy in it.  One bathes baby, while the other makes sure the Puj doesn't open up and hit the faucet handles and change the water temp.  But it is okay because it does hold the baby in place and keep the baby from slipping or moving too much.

title: PUJ Tub is the best!
author: Mrs. L
comments: I LOVE this tub and am so sad little girl has just outgrown it. Baby felt very secure in this tub, saved my back too. I stored it on the bathtub wall on a suction hook; it takes up so little room it will be sorely missed. Very easy to wipe clean. Time to move on to the inflatable with Papillon!

title: PVC Free Tub!
author: M.S.
comments: We loved our Puj Tub until our son grew out of it.  We were looking for a PVC free tub and this was perfect for us.  He absolutely loved the tub and loved taking baths.  The only downside is eventually, you have to get a bigger tub because most babies will grow out of it before they can sit up.  We chose to buy the Flexi-Tub which is also PVC free and is big enough for him to use until he's around 4 years old.  We bought a bath sling to use in the Flexi-Tub while he still is too young to sit up.  Puj Tub does require a specific style of sink to fit properly and safely.  Don't buy the tub if you don't have the right style sink.  All and all a great tub, but you will probably have to buy another tub before your baby can sit up.

title: Waste of money
author: ihsod
comments: The other reviewers who said you need the right size sink are absolutely correct.  Once you fold the tub, it becomes a fixed size that will only fit in the exact right size sink.  Although the material itself is flexible, the tub is not so flexible once it is folded into place.  I tried in all of my sinks at home, and none work quite right.  Also, I felt that the tub was a bit too deep for my newborn.  Once I placed my baby in the tub, it was difficult to clean the baby's back side and bottom based on how deep the baby sits in the tub.  Now I just use it as padding for the bathtub and give my baby a bath in the regular tub.

title: Great for newborns
author: SleeplessinKC
comments: I really liked using this tub for my newborn daughter.  It saved us space and saved my back.  The tub was a little too small for my sink, I ended up using an extra shampoo bottle under the back of the tub to keep the magnets from coming apart.  That was a little annoying but not a big deal.  The material is a firm foam which was soft enough for her delicate skin but firm enough to support her.  I would not use this tub for a baby that lifts her head as the faucet will get in the way, of course that's not the case with a newborn.  I stopped using it when I had trouble cleaning under her rolls and when I felt more confident bathing her in an infant bath sling.

title: Perfect
author: glassman
comments: Was a little skeptical about this.  We've raised 3 children using a "standard" baby tub, but with surprise #4 we were in the market for a tub again.  Found this one and LOVE IT!! Such a simple idea and works great!  Also doesn't take up near as much room as a "standard" baby tub.

title: Cheap Styrofoam type material
author: sna517
comments: Flimsy Styrofoam type material that you are supposed to fold in for the sink. This is NOT hard plastic, and there are no fasteners to secure the  folding. You just hope the pressure of baby and the sink will keep it together. So please note that you cannot use this in a bathtub for this reason. And they charge $40 for this? The margins on this must be 99%. I am returning mine immediately.

title: Not Better Than Expected
author: elliek
comments: When I first decided to get this tub, there weren't too many reviews on it.  The ones that were out there seemed to be positive, so I decided to give it a try since it's soft vs many of the other tubs out there that was just hard plastic.  Well, it's soft, and it is easy to clean and store.  But it didn't fit too well in my sink (standard bathrm sink) and I was constantly worried that my baby will move an arm or leg and hit the faucet.  The tub was wedged in pretty tight so it was hard to get rid of the dirty water so that I can rinse my baby with clean water.  When my baby was a newborn and pretty much didn't move, it was fine.  Once he started to get fussy or move then it was no good.  Eventually I stopped using this one and went with the Prince Lionheart bucket like tub, which worked pretty well, but he outgrew it pretty quickly.  Now I have to spend more $$ to get another tub since he's outgrown that one.  I wish I just went with a regular tub like maybe the Euro Primo one instead of shelling out extra $$ for these gimicky-type tubs.

title: Perfect baby bather!
author: C
comments: Gets the job done and does not take up a huge amount of space; what more do you need in a baby bath tub???

title: LOVE this tub!
author: CJG
comments: I love this tub for my newborn twins! What a great space saver. It fits just fine in the small oval bathroom sink. It's light as a feather, soft, and simple and quick to fold/unfold.

title: Faucet Danger ?
author: RainyDay
comments: Why would anyone design a tub that fits right next to the faucet?  The edges of the spout are not safe.  I really don't understand this product.

title: Only works in SMALL sinks
author: L. Gaffney
comments: I registered for this tub after reading lots of great reviews about it.  It seemed like the perfect solution for people like us who live in small apartments.  However, when we tried it out, we quickly found out that both of our sinks were too BIG for this tub!  We tried it in our kitchen sink and then in our bathroom pedestal sink, but the tub came unsnapped and collapsed immediately when we tried putting our baby in it.  TERRIBLE!!  I realized very quickly that if this tub is not well supported ON ALL SIDES by your sink, it will collapse.  You really need a SMALL bathroom sink for this tub to work.  It's too bad they decided to use magnets for this product.  If they used a real physical snap, or something that connected the tub together more securely, it probably would've worked.  I highly recommend the Primo Infant Bath Seat as a wonderful alternative to this tub.  It's also a space-saving bath seat, and it's about a quarter of the price!

title: Its Amazing!
author: Bethu
comments: This is my first review ever. I love this product so much. My 4 and half month old Daughter loves it. The only problem is my baby is a small baby and right now she is 13 pounds and the Tub is already bending in the sink because of her weight which is like i said just 13 pounds . I am not sure if i can use it for another 1 and half month as the tub  says can be used till 6 moths . Secondly its over priced.Buts other wise its simply great for C- section moms (i had a c  sec too)A must buy . Love it.

title: This is a great way to bathe your baby
author: A B V
comments: This is a great tub. For the designers and engineers out there - you will love this product design. It is elegant, simple and functional.  As parents, we love that we can stand while bathing baby. It saves our backs and knees as well as giving us more control over a wet, slippery baby. It worked great for his first bath and we are still using it as he approaches 6 months.  He'll outgrow it by 7 months but he can then sit up in the bathtub or sink.  The material of this product is great. It never becomes slippery, dries fast, and stores flat on a hook on the back of our bathroom door. This is one of our favorite baby items.

title: Misleading
author: sms1976
comments: I really really wanted to like this tub! But it doesn't fit ANY of the sinks in the house we live in (we have 6 sinks).  Unless you have a laundry room sink or a LARGE sink, this will not fit.  It certainly does not fit the average size sink, I should know since we have 6!

title: we LOVE our Puj!
author: vayacondios
comments: I had registered for the standard blue bathtub--the kind that sits in the kitchen sink, with the green foam inserts and mesh basket for newborns, after about 6 hours of research.  I got the Puj as a gift when our baby was 4 months old, and I only wish I had gotten it earlier.  It is THE BEST bathtub.  I love everything about it.  It is so soft and supportive for the baby, and I can't figure out how she would be able to intake any water, which is its best feature; it is such a safe tub, and that is the biggest reason I love it.  Her head is completely above any water, and there is no risk of her slipping--it is a surface that really grips her skin, and it holds her in a cozy position.  She is much happier in it (she used to scream at deafening decibels throughout her entire bath...now I put a rubber duckie on her stomach during the bath, and she is happy as a clam). With the other tub, I had several friends whose babies had slipped down into the water, and I was always worried she was going to intake water.  I also had to hold her the whole time, or she would flop to the side and hit her head, and that made it tricky to bathe her at the same time.  None of this is a worry with the Puj tub, because it is soft, supportive, and doesn't hold enough water for me to even have to worry about her taking in any water.  I have both hands free to wash her in, and I can't think of another tub that is safe enough to really give you the liberty to have both hands free throughout the entire bath.  Our sink is really small, so the back water outlet is above the sink.  I put a dirty burp rag to catch water back there, and, voila!...problem solved.  There was some concern about the bath floating by one reviewer, but it is not supposed to be on top of any water--it is only supposed to be filled with about 2 cups of water, so it shouldn't be floating on anything...it should be sitting in the sink with an open drain, so the water is draining out of the Puj.  I hooked it on the wall behind the door...some people had complained that it was too wide to put on the door...I don't really see that being such a big deal (the blue bathtub is huge to store--the is 1/2 inch against the wall...I love that).  And, it is SO easy to clean up from a bath, I am saving water--use about 1/5 the amount I did before.  I can set up the bath in 10 seconds, with one hand.  I could go on and on.  It is hands-down, my #1 recommended product for new babies.  You will love it.

title: eh.
author: newmama05
comments: This bathtub looks neat, but that's about the extent of its virtues.  You must have a perfectly sized sink, or the baby falls backwards, the magnets disengage and the whole thing just falls apart.  Using it in a bathroom sink as the picture shows would work fine, but it's just not practical with the faucet directly over baby.  In that case, there is no barrier between faucet and baby if the water temp suddenly rises, risking scalding your little one.  Another inconvenience is that it requires two people: one to bathe baby, and one to hold the bathtub together.  Hate it, don't recommend it.

title: Great for small bathrooms
author: Gretchen Viking
comments: We bought this tub for our second child.  With the first we would have to clear off the counter in the bathroom to put the hard side baby bath tub down.  It was a huge pain. This is wonderful in that it fits in our sink.  I have read other reviewers complaining that the tub floats.  This is true only if you put the tub in the sink AFTER you have filled the sink with water. The manufacturer recommends leaving the sink drain open and only filling until water starts to spill out.  I found that I like the drain closed, so I put the tub in the sink as soon as I start to fill it with water.My daughter loves taking a bath in her tub.  The process is quick, easy and I can do it by myself.  I don't need the spouse to help schlep all the junk necessary with a hard sided tub.

title: Warning - Need the right size sink for this to work!
author: Scusan
comments: I registered for the Puj tub and was excited when it finally arrived.  Unfortunately, when we opened it to test out in 2 bathroom sinks, it didnt work in either (sinks were too shallow and faucets too low).  So beware, if your sink is too big or not deep enough or the faucet is too low, I believe this tub is not going to work.  Its a great design in theory, but unforunately didnt work in our house.

title: Awesome Puj TUB!
author: VRP
comments: Buy this!  It is the best infant bathing system.  Soft and good feel, not cold like other hard plastic tubs.  Baby loved his baths in this one.  Unfortunately, he out grew it by 6 months old.

title: The  best baby tub ever!
author: Nivaska Eastwold
comments: I highly recommend this item is amazing, I feel that I can enjoy my baby while I'm giving him a bath without feeling that he is going to slip or fall. Is amazing my baby loves it! I feel sad that I never got one of this for my 2 first kids!

title: Great tub, runs small, not suitable for all sinks
author: hobbes
comments: This tub is a fabulos concept. I used it in the sink in the master bathroom for my baby for a couple months. Only issue was the faucet on my sink does now swivel so I used to tie it ups o it did not accidentally hit my baby when he started wriggling. Later I also used it in my kitchen sink when he was too big for my bathroom. It did not fit in the sink of our second bathroom. My son is big so outgrew this tub at only 4 months which was soon I felt for what I'd paid. But I will pass it on as it is a very useful thing to have. Ensure you have a sink it fits in tho! I also like the fact that I could hang it flat after a bath so no storage issues.

title: great beginner tub, ideal for travel
author: Amazon Customer
comments: We have used this tub for our 11 week old since he took his first real bath. I love it and wouldn't trade it for anything. I have used it in the kitchen sink, which is square, and also in my smaller oval bathroom sink. I think it works best in the bathroom sink as it is more snug. I leave the faucet on so the water stays warm, the excess flows out the side cut out and down the drain. It cradles our baby so he sits in a comfortable position, and I think he would stay in much longer if I let him. Because of it's design you can hang it up, which is much more convenient than a plastic baby tub. We will be traveling over the holidays and can't imagine having to lug a plastic tub around with us.

title: Nice idea but not functional
