author: Violalove
comments: I was excited to use this product but now it's in the box, used only once. It was suggested to bathe our baby with a sponge bath until his belly button fell off.  By that time he was almost too big for this tub.  When we used it he screamed and we had to take him out to fill with clean water because there is no way to drain the tub.  Nice idea, but not very functional.  We got a bigger tub with a drain that is perfect, similar to this one:  http://www.amazon.com/First-Years-Comfort-Newborn-Toddler/dp/B000GBGO26/ref=sr_1_71?s=baby-products&ie=UTF8&qid=1291923429&sr=1-71  It hooks to the kitchen sink and is so easy to use.

title: Only for a Newborn
author: C. Marsh
comments: When our son was 7 weeks old, he was able to kick out of this tub. The magnet that holds it together was not strong enough for him, so the tub would break open when he wiggled around or with very slight movements. When this happened, of course the water would all leak out.  In addition, the water seeps out through the holes on the side. This tub is only for very tiny baby who do not move. I would give it a one rating, except it does work well for the first month.

title: awsome
author: resse
comments: i love the Puj Tub. i got this tub as a gift at my baby shower and i have been using it for two months now. ive showered my baby every single day from birth and it works great.. it's easy and convient for travels..the only con about it is the weight max. which is to be expected.  my baby was born at 8lbs 4oz and is quickly outgrowing it but i would say it was worth every penny while he could fit in it..

title: Worst tub ever
author: A.T.H.
comments: Seemed like a good idea and got a lot of great reviews.  I hate it.  It is really awkward.  It unfolds and water escapes when you don't want it to and when you'd like to rinse the baby off, you can't get the water out as easily as a regular tub where you'd just pull the plug.  Also, it doesn't hold enough water to keep my baby warm.  Don't waste  your money, go for the $10 tub.

title: An Absolute Life saver, but make sure you have the right faucet.
author: Cheryl J.
comments: I had back problems with my first child and even had to get x-rays done to see if it was serious. The verdict: Too much stress on my back and chest, and we concluded that it was from the recent stress of leaning over the tub. When I got pregnant with my 2nd child I did tons and TONS of internet research to see what the best baby bath tubs were, and I randomly found this while "tub surfing". I read reviews at multiple websites and concluded that this was exactly what I needed.When it finally came I was so excited, but it wouldn't go in my sink, because I had a low faucet (similar to this one: Moen 4938STST Castleby Satine 2 Handle Bathroom Sink Faucet). I had to have the low faucet replaced with a higher one (like this one: Delta Faucet 2538 Lahara Double-Handle Lavatory Faucet, Chrome (Not CA / VT Complaint)) so the tub would fit. (I purchased this same tub for my sister-in-law, and the bowl in her bathroom sink was larger than mine, so she didn't have to replace her low-medium faucet.)After that it was smooth sailing. The investment in a new faucet was 100% worth it, and the puj tub was 1000% worth it! I didn't have to lean over nearly as much, and my daughter absolutely loved it! It's so easy to use and clean, and we were able to get a good 6 months use out of it. Just make sure as your baby gets more active that they don't kick the hot water too high or the cold water too low. Never EVER leave your baby unattended during a bath. Be prepared and you and your baby will have an amazing bath time.

title: WASTE of MONEY
author: LinSuk
comments: Does not stay together in the sink or a plastic bowl... Wish I could get my money back! My baby is is 4 weeks and she unfolds the tub.. WASTE OF MONEY! Being used as a floor mat and it works great on my hard wood floors!

title: doesn't hold water
author: Virginia Price
comments: At first the tub worked wonderfully, but as soon as my baby got to eight pounds (where the average baby starts) the tub wouldn't hold water anymore.  It all ran out the holes, leaving just a puddle.  I presume the holes are for "safety".  What was once a fun activity became a chore for both me and the baby.  I've just ordered a real tub for half the price.  Wish me luck.

title: The awesome Puj
author: viv
comments: The most perfect infant tub.  It is perfect for preemie's and now for my 12 lb grandson.  With room for more growth.  The design is genius. The possibility for accidental drowning are slim if any. Great great product.  Durable, travels and stores easily.

title: Puj Tub I Love You
author: Cchea D. Nugent
comments: This tub was on backorder at the store I shop at when my son was born.  But when it finally came in, oh how I wished I had had this tub from day 1!!!  There is no hard plastic pockets that are difficult to clean.  It lays flat and cleans soooo easily.  It fits perfectly into my bathroom sink (though if my faucet were much lower, his knee would hit it) and I can stand to bathe my baby.  NO BACK PAIN!!!  Ahhhhhh.  It is soft for him to lay on.  There is no mesh hammock for my VERY wiggly little one to try to roll off of.  It keeps enough water in the bottom to keep him warm during bath, and I just use a bath luve over the top of him to keep him warm also.  Unlike the Tummy Tub, his body is accessible and much easier to clean.  Getting to his back takes a bit of raising up on him, but even that is as easy if not easier in this tub than any other tub I've used with him.  He is now almost six months old and starting to be too big for it though.  :(  I will be sad to see the Puj Tub leave our house.  It has truly been one of my all-time favorite baby products!!!

title: Really wanted to love this bath
author: D. Johnson
comments: I really wanted to love this bath.  It has everything I was looking for: modern, space saving, for the sink.  But it did not fit well into my sink, which I don't think is an odd size.  And my newborn was not stable in it and even holding her up with one hand while I washed her felt unsteady.  I think the concept is great but it just didn't work for us.  I see that people like it so much and I can't fully understand why it didn't work for me.

title: Love it!!
author: Mary_WV8633
comments: I love this!  Our baby is comfortable and relaxed in this tub and it is eoooo easy to use and store.  Great product and well worth the price.  I would recommend this to any new parent.

title: truely sucks. I
author: Sarah Lamothe
comments: Let me just say, we are first time parents, so I have nothing to compare this to.But I know it was a big waste of money.At three weeks when my son's cord fell off he got his first bath and boy was it stressful and awkward! This thing barely fit in my bathroom sink, and my faucet was inches away from him. It also only holds about a cup and a half of water in it, so I was basically giving him a sponge bath. We had to fill water pitchers in the tub to use as rinse water. He hated all of this so much that I cried.The next time I tried using it in my larger kitchen sink, and as others described, the sink was too big and the shape didn't hold/magnets came apart. My 60 year old mother exclaimed, "this sucks!" and removed the puj, put a towel in the sink, and held him while I washed.Now my babe is three months and for the past two months he gets two baths a week with his dad. Dad holds him while being in the tub, and I wash him from an outside of the tub kneeling position. Babe loves this and smiles a whole bunch! In another month the babe will be able to sit up on his own, so no baby tub needed.Final thoughts: its not really a bath if you are just sitting in a cup of water around your bum, that is just poop soup. This thing is a great concept, but poorly executes.

title: fantastic tub, ideal for small baby
author: RealGeeky
comments: i saw this advertised in a baby magazine when i was pregnant and thought it would be great for my baby.  i LOVE this!!  It is so soft and my baby fits in it perfectly.  At first I was very tentative and I held my baby tightly while bathing her, but now that she is older I can let go and she stays perfectly put.  It is a great buy.  I wish their magnets were stronger as often she kicks the flaps apart.  But otherwise it is fantastic.  Well worth the money.

title: Best Tub for the first few months
author: BG
comments: I loved this tub and I am so sad my baby outgrew it. She loves it too and wouldn't complain if I kept stuffing her in it but, at 5 months, 26in, and 14lbs, she's really too big for it. I don't know what kind of sinks the negative reviewers had but it fits my sink (molded shell sink) and a hotel sink (undermount sink) fine. It does collapse in my kitchen sink but it's not really meant for square sinks. Here's my pro's and con's:Pros:- very comfortable for baby- constantly drains so water stays fresh and baby gets rinsed easily- takes up no space (I hung it on the back of the bathroom door)- cradles baby securely so parent's hands are free- no bending!! baby is right there with you- baby can look in mirror while being bathed my daughter loved this- baby has a blast playing with the water coming out of the faucetCons:- You'll be lucky if you can push using this to 5 months. Most babies will probably outgrow it by 3 - 4 months- expensive, it's a great idea but that's what you're paying for, it probably cost them about $0.20 to make- It does mark up easy and after 5 months of use it definitely looks used, no passing this on to someone else.To me it was worth the money because it made bathing my newborn so easy I couldn't imagine anything else. I tried those plastic tubs with the mesh and my daughter just wasn't comfortable in them and they are so huge to store. I also tried the little bath seats and those stink because she wasn't in the water having fun. With the puj she could be crying like crazy and if I put her in the bathroom she would be instantly happy.

title: Great for bathing small infants
author: A. Martini
comments: We have loved our Puj tub. It fits perfectly into the various bathroom sinks in our house and, with adjustment of the angle based on her size at the time, drained perfectly, keeping her head above the water but body mostly in it for warmth. It cradles their bodies so well. At a large three months, she is on the verge of outgrowing it, but it has been great for us. Now she can hold her head up and sit with support, we are looking into a larger tub that will last through the toddler stage. She loves bathtime in her Puj tub, though not always getting dried off after. ;)

title: Puj Tub
author: AmazonMom
comments: We bathe our newborn in the Puj. He fits perfectly in the kitchen sink =) He's happy and so are we.Our baby is now 5 months old (26 inches & 16 pounds) and we are still using the PUJ. My husband and I love this baby bath tub and so does our baby. A lot of the reviews don't do this product any justice.1. The tub is still in great condition as we bathe baby every other day. Other types of tubs would have had soap scum or other build up by now. I am very happy that I haven't had to clean and scrub this tub.2. We bathe baby in the kitchen sink and leave the water running so that the water supply is constant and fresh. Yes the water runs out of the holes, but that is good because he's not sitting in old dirty water (potty accidents). He doesn't get cold because we are constantly rubbing soap on him and rinsing him with the fresh, warm water. When it's time to drain the tub, we simply flip it over so that it is inverted in the sink while we dry and dress baby. It is so easy.3. Yes, the tub floats-it's made of a soft, foam-like material. You're not supposed to fill or plug the sink and place the tub in it. Watch the video and you'll see how the tub is supposed to be used. If you'd rather not bathe baby that way, maybe the PUJ isn't the tub for you.4. We position the PUJ diagonally in our square kitchen sink and it has never lost it's shape or had the magnets disengage when we used it correctly. The only time that happened was when I tried to fill the sink before bathtime, which is the wrong way to use the PUJ.The PUJ is a lifesaver! I am a new mom and was very anxious about bathtime. It can be very dangerous bathing a newborn/infant and I feel that the PUJ has prevented bathtime accidents that might have occurred if we used another type of tub. I have had experiences with other babies and other bath tubs and those experiences were not nearly as pleasant as the PUJ.

title: Great for new babies to bathe in kitchen sink.
author: Granny
comments: I bought this "Puj Tub" when my daughter brought our 1.5 month old grandson for a visit.  It is so simple and ingenious!  Wish I had invented it.  Magnets hold the sturdy, but pliable foam in shape for bathing in the sink, and then it can be rinsed or washed off and hung up flat to dry.  It fits very well in the sink and is soft and comfortable, but not too flimsy.  It cradles the infant very well and a small hold in the bottom lets the soapy water run out.  Since it is flat, it is easy to take in the car for trips.  My daughter took it home to use on another trip.  The video I watched before purchasing it showed it being used in a very small bathroom sink.  We chose to use it in the kitchen so that we could keep warm water running in the other side of our double kitchen sink to rinse the baby with cups of warm water.  The baby enjoyed every minute of it.

title: Not Sturdy, Waste of Money
author: gyps808
comments: I read the reviews of this and thought it sounded great!  When we got it, it looked like it would really work, but then we tried to wash our newborn we watched as the tub deformed in the sink, and as we held onto him the magnets popped apart thereby making the entire thing a big flopping mess.  Talk about scaring new parents!Also, they forget to mention that you can't use it immediately as you need to wait until the baby's umbilical cord falls off.  Then they outgrow it when they hit about 2-3 months.  So for $40 you get 1.5 month's worth of use.  Bad economics, really.It wouldn't fit any of our sinks so we shoved it into our kitchen sink so at least he couldn't hit the faucet of our bathroom sinks.  I refused to let $40 go to waste, but I'm ashamed to say we weren't able to bathe the baby as often as I wanted because the tub was a total safety hazard if there weren't two of us there to bathe him.Pro:  Soft on baby's skin, folds up flat to hang on wall and takes up no space whatsoever.Cons:  Magnets don't hold, can't use until umbilical cord falls off at about 3 weeks then baby outgrows it at about 12 pounds or so at 2 or 3 months (basically 1.5 months worth of use), was impossible for me to use by myself because it would either deform in the sink (deeper sink) or he would fling his head or arms into the faucet (normal bathroom sink).

title: Great for newborns!
author: A. Finan
comments: The Puj tub worked like a charm for our baby for the first two months.  It is great because you can leave the faucet running and the water continuously drains from the tub through the drain holes, so the water doesn't stay soapy or dirty.  It is perfect for newborns, but our girl is 9 weeks now (11 lbs) and her weight unfolds the tub while she's in it.  This tub is good for deeper oval shaped sinks.  If you have a very shallow sink, the tub won't fit right.  We used it daily and loved it, and are very sad that our girl outgrew it.  I'm buying one for every baby shower from now on!

title: Flimsy, shipped in poor condition, and cheap
author: R. A. Green
comments: I was very excited when my mother-in-law said she had purchased this tub for me - I read the reviews and I have a bad back, so I was looking forward to avoiding back aches.  First, it took forever to arrive - probably about 10 days at least from when my mother-in-law claimed she ordered it and it was to be shipped quickly, as she is a Prime member.  Secondly, once the package arrived, it was poorly packaged and was bent.  It was a in a thin box and the tub itself has a large crease in it.  Third, I'm not sure why it is so costly - it's basically a foam mold.  I'll take my chances with something a little more durable, even if it means washing her in the tub.  I think I'll try my laundry sink before I use this.  Since it creased relatively easily, it would seem to lose its shape and I really don't see anything too special about it, especially for the price.  I'm returning it.

title: Great Product/Concept!
author: Daria2k1
comments: This is a great bath! My youngest son did not like the standard baby baths that are out there. I found the PUJ while doing a search and thought that I would never pay $40.00 for a baby bath, especially one that won't last through the later stages of infancy( only rated to 17 lbs. and my kids are over 9 lbs at birth). I decided to try it out and have loved it!! My son feels safe in this tub unlike in the standad baby baths. The tub is soft and flexable, it cradles him which makes him feel secure. It is so light and easy to fold. The best part is that it's PBA/PVC free. The tub is designed to fit in the bathroom sink or a pedestal sink. I found that it worked best for me in the kitchen sink, probaby because my son is so big. He fit in the bathroom sink as well but the kitchen was more comfortable for both of us.I can't say enough about it!! I wish they would make something that would work for babies over 17lbs, obvioulsy not a fold up sink tub but a regular baby bath that is light weight, BPA/PVC free. The only other downside is the price!

title: With a modification works great even for my big baby.
author: Catherine
comments: This tub definitely does NOT fit well in a sink with a short faucet (regular faucet) and does not work in the kitchen sink.  We have a new home and were planning to upgrade our faucet anyway and so we opted for a goose neck faucet that can also move from side to side for our daughters bathroom.  With this modification the tub fits great in the sink.  My daughter loves being in the tub and enjoys looking in the bathroom mirror while she is bathed.  Some have said that it is not good for big babies.My daughter is currently about 12-13 lbs and is in the 96th percentile for length and this tub still works fine (at 2 months old).  I can see that she will grow out of it in the next 6-8 weeks though... which will be unfortunate.  It is great to be able to stand up and bathe her instead of leaning over the tub.Update:My baby girl is now 4 months old and is now 97th percentile for length (26in) and weighs almost 16lbs.  Though she fills up the tub she does still fit in it and we still use it everyday.  Will definitely use this tub with the next baby!

title: Puj tub rocks!
author: Spoon
comments: Puj tub is an excellent space saver tub for infants.  My daughter had her first bath in this tub.  This tub made it so easy to give her a bath especially for the first time parents like us.  Its over flow holes keep water shallow enough that you don't have to worry about the baby drowning yet it has good neck & body support especially for little infants.  What I really like about it is that when I was done, this tub can be stored flat hanging from the wall so it doesn't take up any space in the bathroom.Highly recommended for first time parents who doesn't have enough room to have traditional infant bathtubs.

title: does NOT fit most sinks as claimed
author: Organic Mom
comments: This tub is a great idea, however, it doesn't fit "most standard sinks" as it claims to. I have tried it in our home, in our rental condo as well as my mother's home and it hasn't fit a single sink I've tried. When folded, the bottom makes a pretty deep point-when you try to put it in the sink, it just topples over to one side (usually facing you). The other side gets wedged underneath the faucet. It's impossible to get it to sit as shown.Secondly, it marks up very badly, very easily. I put it in a suitcase and when I took it out, it was covered in black "scuff" marks that won't come out, no matter what you do. So it makes it look terrible and I won't even give it away looking like it does.Because of these problems, it is most certainly not worth $40. They need to make revisions to this-SUCH a great idea though.

title: Buyer Beware
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Loved the idea - and product was as described - but was really shocked when I tried to put it in the Kitchen sink and it slowly lost shape with the baby in it - most uncomfortable for her - and really hard to get her out of the misshapen Puj.  I contacted customer service about it - and was basically given a "tough luck" from them.  Waste of money if you are looking to use the kitchen sink - better off just lining it with a towel and saving your cash.

title: It's too small for my baby and did not fit in most sinks as it claims to.
author: Amelia's mom
comments: I was sold on this tub due to the fold flat for easy dry, fits in sink and it being non-toxic, BPA free and made in the US.  The problem is that it did not fit in any of my bathroom sinks - the faucet is dangerously close to baby and too awkward to get her in and out.  I was able to use it in my kitchen sink.  My 3 month old baby is in the top 95th percentile for her height and weight - has been since two months old - was 24 inches long when I started using this product and she was very scrunched up but didn't seem to mind.  I finally purchased the First Years Sure Comfort Infant-Toddler Tub last weekend and started using it today and I have to say that It is so much better - more room and fits securely on top of the double sink in my kitchen...and it was only $18.  I wish I got that in the first place and didn't waste the $40 on this one.  If you have a tiny baby, this might work but if you have a long baby do not waste your money on this.

title: Successful at what it is
author: Jinky
comments: I bought this because we don't own a bathtub and don't have room to store those large baby tubs.  It has worked very well for its purpose (stores flat, fits in our small, odd-shaped sink).  I would, however, like to mention some minor frustrations.First, rubbing the material makes a horrid squeak, like when Styrofoam is rubbed.  I know, it's a minor thing, but I really just hate that sound, and it happens whenever I shift my baby in the tub.Second, I have learned to bolster the back of the tub (where her head is) with a rolled-up towel, or else the tub will cave backwards.  The material just isn't rigid enough to support the weight of her head/upper body without the added support. This may not happen with everyone, but it does with my shallow sink.Third, my daughter is now just under four months old and she's almost grown out of using the tub.  Granted, I never expected to be able to wash her in the sink forever :)  But I though it would give us more time than it has.Such small matters aside, it has proven to be an inexpensive and practical way to bathe my little girl for the last four months, and so I consider the purchase a success.

title: Great product
author: M. Blekh
comments: Baby loves this bath tub!! And is very light and soft and fits great into the sink.

title: Perfect!
author: Shelley R. Drury
comments: I purchased this as a shower gift. I must say I am very jealous! I wished I knew of this product a year ago when I had my child. It is made really well and I love that you can hang it up and it does not take up much space at all. This is the tub all new moms should have. Love it!

title: The Best Tub
author: TillyMom
comments: This tub is great!  As a new mom I was so concerned about bathing my tiny, slippery baby safely.This tub alleviated all my concerns when bathing my newborn.  It is so simple, so comfy for baby.I would recommend this tub time and time again, and I have! :-)

title: LOVE IT!
author: Lukyhit
comments: I was a bit on the fence about buying this product. Because I didn't think it would be big enough for a 6 month old baby like it says, I also had concerns about whether it would fit in my sink. I am so glad I ordered it! It fits great in both my bathroom and kitchen sinks. It will definately hold a bigger baby. The tub is made up out foamie stuff that is sturdy yet moldable. The foam keeps the baby from sliding all over the place. The angle at which the baby sits is perfect. They are snug and secure. Folds up so easy my 4 year old can do it. When you are done with it unfold it and hang it up. It saves a ton of space from the tradition hard plastic bathtubs. Love it! I don't know how I lived without it with my first child. This will definatley be the gift I buy any one having a baby.

title: Requires a specific sink size/type
author: T. Lee
comments: This tub seems like a great idea for young infants, however, it does not work with the sinks in our home.We have fairly standard bathroom sinks in our townhome (4' countertop with an oval sink that slopes from 4.5" in the front to 5.5" deep in the back).  Unfortunately, the Puj Tub did not sit deep enough in the sink to work properly.  Our kitchen sink is 6.5" deep, which seemed to be the right depth, but the tub seems to need an oval-shaped sink for support.

title: Good idea but only for tiny infants
author: lalalulu
comments: We are currently using the Primo Eurobath for our not-quite-2-month-old son. Being a rather large tub, it is difficult to lift to empty the water after the baths, not to mention the pain of having to squat on the floor holding the baby. This is why I was excited to try out the Puj tub in our bathroom sink, standing.Although I was a bit wary that the magnets that create the curve would be too flimsy, it seemed to work. Placing the tub in the sink, it seemed to be a rather tight fit, but when I tried to place my son in it was when the real problem started. I had to practically squeeze his leg under the faucet and when in place, he did not look nearly as comfortable as the baby in the picture. In fact, that picture looks a lot roomier than what I saw, and my baby is a 75 percentile baby at 2 months while the Puj claims to be for 0-6 month babies. Meanwhile, he was also screaming his lungs off.The material is soft, it fits in the tub, and the design seems to have been well thought out (the holes did ensure that the water did not run over, etc etc) but I'm guessing my son might have looked like the baby in the picture for the first couple of weeks and that's it.The Eurobath has its faults, but nevertheless, it's always done the job and I've never had a problem with it. I was hoping for a miracle, but alas... maybe it was all wishful thinking.

title: BEST BABY BATH TUB!
author: K. Wride
comments: Oh wow this tub is amazing!  They are so simple to use and cute, and you can just hang them on the back of your bathroom door and no one will ever know!  I am so glad someone invented this tub, it makes life so much easier for moms and dads!!!!  No more leaning over the side of the tub with your knees breaking, just stand at the sink and bathe baby in a calm, comfortable setting, without any stress!  Plus you don't feel like you have to hang onto your baby for dear life, you can actually use two hands to bathe!  This is a wonderful product and I recommend it to everyone I know and to you!!!  Also, their website [...] has some fun stuff on it too, I see!

title: This tub saved my back!
author: J. F.
comments: First of all, I've never cared enough about a product to take time out of my busy schedule in order to write a review, so this should tell you how much I truly love this product.  I absolutely love this tub! I went through three infant tubs - a whale and two meshy type things that went in the sink, and none of those worked for me.  It hurt so bad to lean over the tub or in the floor to try to bathe my baby in the whale. In the meantime, it was hard to move him around, get him clean, and rinse him as well because I was having to strain.  The whale tub was too tall to put on a counter or an island.  When I tried the meshy type things in the sink, these didn't keep him warm at all and he hated them!  You couldn't get him clean on those at all. Bath time wasn't fun because I was uncomfortable, he was chilly, and he couldn't play in the water.I saw an ad on facebook for this tub and I was extremely skeptical because my sink wasn't truly round.  It's sort of square at the top and rounded on the bottom.  But man, was I pleasantly surprised.  I just fold up one of the sides and it conforms well to the sink.  My baby absolutely LOVES it!  He laughs and plays now in the water. It's really so easy, you just literally throw it in the sink and you can stand up, without hurting your back, and bathe baby.  Then, when bathtime is over, you just toss the water out of it, unfold it and hang it up to dry on a hook or lay it flat and wipe it once with a towel.  It's seriously the best baby product I have and my husband and I enjoy giving our baby a bath every day!  You must purchase this tub - you won't regret it! Especially if your back hurts like mine. This makes bath time so much fun for baby!  It's soft, cradles his little body so well, and is so flexible!  His first laugh was in the bath. :)

title: perfect solution to bathing baby with older child in bathtub
author: MelissaGM
comments: I was a little skeptical at first that this would actually work in my sink, which is small, but this fits with no problem!! it is light weight, flexible and soft, which molds easily into your sink. You can also adjust it so that baby is more upright or lays back.  It IS easy to use with just one hand which is essential.  I love that I can bathe my baby while my toddler is in the bath tub. The Puj also allows me to bathe baby with two hands.  He is safe and comfortable in the Puj and the only time I feel I have to hold on to him is when I rinse the shampoo out of his head.  With the two other tubs I have used, I never felt  comfortable letting go of him completely. The best thing of all is that my baby loves this tub and actually smiles!! I think because he knows I feel more comfortable which relaxes him. Previously, he cried in whatever I tried to bathe him in! It's also nice because he is closer to me & higher up so that probably makes him more relaxed as well. The only problem is that I doubt we can use this as my baby gets much bigger. He is 8 weeks old and a long baby, so I doubt we can use it through 6 months...otherwise, it's a bit pricey but to me, well worth it!  Before the Puj I rarely bathed him, but now I do it every night and I find he sleeps much better!

title: Love this tub!
author: AirForceMom
comments: This is my third child, and I've used three different tubs... and with each one, the size decreases.  I'm so glad I found this.  I can bathe my two boys in the tub, and my baby I can wash at the same time in the sink.  When I'm done, all I do is pop it out and dry in the tub!  No lugging or searching for a place to store it!  He loves the tub, and the water stays clean as I bathe him.
